Tweet: Today Egyptian officials revealed the discovery of a 30-foot-long corridor inside one of the Pyramids of Giza. The officials say they also discovered a clue as to what the 30-foot-long corridor was used for: "King Tut" embroidered in hieroglyphics on a bowling shirt.

Prince Harry and Meghan have been asked to move out of Frogmore Cottage, their official royal residence in the United Kingdom. The good news is, because Prince Harry is fifth in line to the throne, they can always stay at an Heir-bnb.

Yesterday Russian President Vladimir Putin awarded the Order of Friendship to action-movie actor Steven Seagal. Observers say that the award was made to express how grateful movie-lovers are to Steven Seagal for not making any more movies.

A new study says that the artificial sweetener erythritol may raise the risk of a heart attack. When asked for comment, Starbucks officials said that their coffees have no erythritol, so the only thing that might cause a heart attack is their price.

The Dr. Seuss book 'How the Grinch stole Christmas!' is getting a sequel. It takes place a few Christmases after the first book. In the sequel, because his heart grew three sizes, the Grinch burglarizes Whoville Hospital and steals all their pacemakers.

In a clinical trial, an experimental nasal vaccine gave strong protection against Covid infection. And here's more good news: the vaccine gives even stronger protection when you also take two N95 masks and stuff them up inside your nostrils.
Yesterday the FDA ruled that soy, oat, and almond drinks can keep calling themselves milk. The dairy industry was pretty angry. In fact, some cows gave the FDA their middle teat.

In Texas over the weekend, at a stock show and rodeo, a team of Budweiser Clydesdales got tangled up and collapsed to the ground. Which answers the question, "Did the Clydesdales enjoy Budweiser's Pre-Rodeo Happy Hour?"

Today Home Depot announced that it'll raise the pay of its store workers to a minimum of $15 an hour. Company officials say they'll ask Accounting to issue the new paychecks as soon as they can track down somebody who works in that department.
It's Presidents Day 2023. As his tribute to George Washington, President Biden ordered the Air Force to chop down a Chinese cherry tree with a Sidewinder missile.
Now in theaters is a new R-rated slasher movie starring Winnie the Pooh. It's so disturbing, it starts with a Tigger warning.

A judge suggested that jail might be the best way to stop FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried from communicating on electronic devices. Which is surprising because there is an electronic device that the judge actually ordered Bankman-Fried to use: a Flowbee hair clipper.

Next week McDonald's in Germany is introducing plant-based McNuggets. McDonald's officials guarantee that if you love Chicken McNuggets you'll also love plant-based McNuggets because neither one contains any chicken.

Yesterday North Korea unveiled a series of postage stamps featuring Kim Jong Un's ten-year-old daughter. Kim Jong Un said he got the idea when his daughter mentioned she was collecting stamps to mail herself out of North Korea.
It's Valentine's Day 2023 and Cupid has been really busy this year. That's because he's been shooting most of his arrows to deflate Chinese spy balloons.

Ford is building a $3.5 billion factory in Michigan to produce batteries for its electric vehicles. They're also building a $3.5 billion factory in California to supply batteries for the devices in Gwyneth Paltrow's nightstand.
Holy cow! #SuperBowl turning point: A Kansas City 42-yard field goal attempt was just blocked by a Chinese spy balloon!
To help astronauts survive on long missions, researchers are studying hibernating Arctic ground squirrels. They're also developing a new type of space food for the astronauts: dehydrated acorns.
This Sunday in Arizona is Super Bowl 2023. But sadly, today the preparations were marred by controversy. On its way to the stadium, the Goodyear Blimp was mugged by a Chinese spy balloon.

Netflix confirmed that it'll start charging users who share their account with people outside their home. Apparently the last straw was when Netflix traced sixty million unauthorized streamers of "Fuller House" to that Chinese spy balloon.

There was an awkward moment last night at President Biden's State of the Union speech when Jill Biden kissed Kamala Harris's husband on the mouth. The good news is, Jill Biden said her tongue search didn't turn up any more classified documents.

Chinese officials are still saying it was a weather balloon that was shot down and they want it back. The situation is getting tense. Now China is threatening to not tell people going outdoors in the U.S. when to take an umbrella.

Last night Taylor Swift won a Grammy for Best Music Video, and people are still talking around the security lapse. During her acceptance speech, out of nowhere, the stage was crashed by a Chinese spy balloon.

American officials said that the Chinese spy balloon wasn't able to collect much meaningful intelligence data. They said that to get really important classified secrets it would have had to float into President Biden's garage.

A Chinese spy balloon is flying over the continental United States. Chinese officials insist it's not a spy balloon, and ask the U.S. to wish them luck with their audition for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

It's Groundhog Day, and in Pennsylvania this morning Punxsutawney Phil came out of his burrow and saw his shadow. You know what that means…six more weeks of trying to remember what it means when he sees his shadow.

Today Australian authorities said that a radioactive capsule that fell off the back of a truck has been found. To make sure no other radioactive objects get lost, they also unveiled their new radioactive boomerang.

Krispy Kreme just introduced heart-shaped doughnuts filled with cream and made with real Hershey's chocolate. They're perfect for Valentine's Day. Not only are they delicious, but it'll be easier for Cupid's arrow to hit you if you put on forty pounds.

Authorities are searching for a highly radioactive capsule that fell off a truck in Australia. To locate the capsule, the authorities are looking for elevated radiation levels, unusual gamma rays, or a fifty-foot-tall kangaroo.

Recently a company in Japan introduced vending machines that sell whale meat. And most Japanese people are saying no thanks. The only thing they want to buy from a vending machine is a piping hot cup of squid ink.

A U.S. tourist was fined for driving his rental car over a centuries-old, medieval Italian bridge. The Italians were waving their hands, swearing a mile a minute, gesturing wildly…and then they saw the car on the bridge.
In an Oscar snub, Tom Cruise did not get an acting nomination for "Top Gun: Maverick." Insiders say he got a lot of votes but came up short.

Today a 4.2 magnitude earthquake struck near Malibu, California. The shaking was so hard that one lane of the Pacific Coast Highway was temporarily closed due to large chunks falling off Cher's plastic surgery.
It's the Chinese New Year—the Year of the Rabbit. To celebrate, President Biden visited a third-grade classroom and showed the kids how to make little origami rabbits out of classified documents.

Chase Bank announced that it's closing some ATM vestibules in New York City at 5 pm because of rising crime. The good news is, bank officials say that customers who need cash after hours can always do what other New Yorkers do and pick somebody's pocket.
Retired astronaut Buzz Aldrin just got married to his "longtime love." His astronaut friends say he's over the moon…in a nearly-circular, equatorial orbit with a period of 88 minutes.

A RI police department granted the request of a young resident to have a cookie DNA tested to determine if Santa Claus bit it. The police agreed because they already had a comparison sample of Santa's DNA left over from their investigation into a series of reindeer molestations.

A woman in India broke a Guinness World Record by using one hand to set up a chess board in under 30 seconds. No word on why she wants to set up a chess board so fast, but chances are it's not because she's expecting a visit from the Kardashians.
The party supplies chain Party City has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. Finally they have a use for all those unsold Sexy Bankruptcy Lawyer costumes.

Researchers found a Scandinavian rune stone with writing that may be 2,000 years old. The rune stone was sent immediately to the University of Oslo by Joe Biden, who says he doesn't remember how it got in his garage.
FEMA fired a group that did an insultingly bad job of translating some documents into Alaska Native languages. When asked for comment, Alaska Natives proved that they have 50 words for "a-hole."

Prince Harry's memoir "Spare" is now the fastest-selling non-fiction book of all time. Even the Royal Family bought half a million copies. It's winter, so they're using them to feed all the fireplaces in Buckingham Palace.

NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope confirmed the existence of an exoplanet 41 light-years away from Earth. And this is interesting…on the exoplanet, the telescope detected the existence of another batch of classified documents left there by Joe Biden.

Today the White House confirmed that more classified documents were found in President Biden's home, in his garage. Even worse was the bumper sticker on his Corvette: "How's my document security? Call 1-800-F**K YOU."
Prince Harry's book "Spare" was released yesterday and it's already sold over a million copies. Not to be outdone, today President Biden released a new batch of one million classified documents.

Documents marked "classified" were found in Joe Biden's old office. Apparently Biden prepared the documents so long ago that the word "classified" is written on parchment with those tall Ss that look like Fs.

The CEO of Disney just ordered all hybrid employees to come back into the office four days a week. He would have said five days a week, but because it's Disney, employees have to spend a whole day outside in the hot sun waiting in line to get in the building.

Early this morning, lying New York Republican George Santos was sworn into Congress. You could tell he's trying to improve his image. When he raised his right hand, he wore mittens so you couldn't see his fingers were crossed.

Trader Joe's is being sued because its dark chocolate allegedly contains lead and cadmium. In their defense, company officials say the chocolate is the perfect Valentine's Day gift for fans of the periodic table.
A Canadian company just introduced its new self-driving baby stroller. Because the baby stroller is self-driving, it lets you keep your hands free so you can call the police to report a missing baby.

Today Rick Singer, the mastermind of that big college admissions scam, was sentenced to 3 and a half years in prison. But he asked the judge to give him another half a year because he said you need a sentence of 4.0 to get into one of the top prisons.

Today Sam Bankman-Fried, the former CEO of bankrupt crypto exchange FTX, pleaded not guilty to federal criminal charges. Actually, what happened was he entered 32 billion non-fungible not guilty pleas, which the court exchanged for one real not guilty plea.
Condoms are now free in French pharmacies for everyone younger than 26 years old. French people older than 26 plan to continue practicing birth control for free by not using deodorant.

Last night at midnight was the big New Year's Eve ball drop in Times Square. Thousands and thousands of complete strangers stood around and waited for hours, which is why this year the event was sponsored by Southwest Airlines.
Thousands of pages of Donald Trump’s tax returns were finally released today. Paper copies of his tax returns would have been released yesterday, but the printer kept running out of red ink.

A lot of people are making New Year's resolutions to lose weight. And they're getting some nice encouragement from New York Representative-elect George Santos. He told them, "If I can lose twenty-eight hundred pounds, anyone can."

This week, New York Congressman-elect George Santos admitted that he embellished his education and employment history. In his defense, he said it was all part of his tireless campaign to increase the job security of New York's resume checkers.
This week the Chinese military sent 71 aircraft toward Taiwan in 24 hours. The good news is, 200 other Chinese aircraft didn't go anywhere because their flights were cancelled by Southwest Airlines.
It's Boxing Day 2022. To celebrate, the FBI boxed up six more stacks of classified documents at Mar-a-Lago.
It's Christmas, a very special holiday in our nation's capital. That's because Christmas pageants are the only time Washington has three wise men.

Congress just passed a $1.7 trillion spending bill.  Because it's Christmas Eve, they added a few items at the last minute. The environmentalists got 7 swans a-swimming, the farmers got 6 geese a-laying, and the taxpayers have to give the IRS 5 golden rings to help pay for it.

A "bomb cyclone" disrupted the holiday travel plans for millions of Americans. The good news is, apparently it didn't affect travel between FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried's jail cell and his parents' house.
Sam Bankman-Fried, founder of the crypto exchange FTX, is flying to the U.S. to face criminal charges. But he made a good deal: by taking that flight, he'll earn 10,000 frequent fraudster miles.

Officials in Boulder, Colorado, closed the main library after methamphetamine residue was found in the restroom air ducts. In a library? That's shocking! Methamphetamine residue should be on the Nonfiction Crime shelf under "M."

A dog who went missing from his owner's house in California was found 1,600 miles away in Kansas. When asked for comment, the owner in California said his dog was always running away chasing squirrels, cars, and lower taxes.
On this day in history, December 17, 1903, Wilbur and Orville Wright became the first people to successfully fly an airplane. The very next day, Wilbur and his fiancée joined the Yard High Club.
Yesterday a nuclear engineering student won the title of Miss America. Her training came in handy because one of the losing contestants couldn’t take it and had a meltdown.

Today on Netflix, the Harry and Meghan documentary is the #3 TV show in the U.S. and "The Crown" is down at #10 on the list. Insiders say that Harry is thrilled because that’s the closest he'll ever get to the Crown.

The Texas man who holds the Guinness World Record for the largest collection of video games said his collection has now grown to over 24,000 games. When asked if he still loves video games, the man gave a thumbs up, down, up, down, left, right, right, B, Start.

U.S. scientists successfully created a nuclear fusion reaction by heating a target to over 5 million degrees Fahrenheit. But it almost didn't work when one of the scientists' dads barged in and turned the thermostat down to 68.

Weber, the grill company, is being taken private in a deal valued at about $3.7 billion. The deal was done perfectly. First they signed the contracts on one side, then they flipped them over and signed them on the other side.

Today in New York City is SantaCon 2022, where hundreds of people dressed as Santa Claus raise money for charity by going on a bar crawl. But don’t worry about all those drunken Santas messing up the street. Their beards soak up the vomit.

Arizona Senator Kyrsten Sinema is leaving the Democratic Party, and political observers are surprised. Usually when a Democrat leaves a party suddenly around the holidays it's because Andrew Cuomo got handsy at the punch bowl.

Archaeologists in Turkey found a 10,000-year-old wall carving of a man holding his genitals. Right next to it was a carving of a small boy holding a club and symbols translated as "Turkey's Funniest Home Wall Carvings."

Nantucket just approved a bylaw amendment that will let everybody go topless on beaches, "to promote equality for all persons." They also amended the limerick to read "There once was a person from Nantucket" and "unspecified sex organ."
According to a lawsuit, actor Bill Cosby is facing new accusations of sexual assault from five women. That’s bound to put a dent in the sales of his new holiday product, Bill Cosby brand mistletoe.

New research just revealed a popular toy of prehistoric children: small stones carved with the images of owls. Also a popular toy for prehistoric children: a stone-age version of a little Hot Wheels car they called Not Wheels.

Yesterday police officials in New York City warned that pickpockets are taking advantage of big holiday season crowds. So, people in New York City, if you're in a crowd and you feel a little push, it may not just be somebody stabbing you.
Reports say that this Christmas season there's a shortage of Santa Clauses. Apparently many mall Santas are suffering from a long-term, debilitating condition known as "chapped lap."

The first-look trailer for "Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny" starring Harrison Ford just dropped. I don't want to say that Indiana Jones is getting old, but the Dial of Destiny turns up his hearing aid.

An image of the Rolling Stones is on a new collectible coin issued by Britain’s Royal Mint. The Stones say they are particularly delighted to be on a coin because they happened to be playing a concert in Mesopotamia when money was invented.
The Mauna Loa volcano in Hawaii is still erupting, spewing toxic smoke, destructive lava, and poisonous gas. And here's an update: Donald Trump just invited Mauna Loa to dinner.

Today first lady Jill Biden revealed this year's White House Christmas decorations, which include 77 Christmas trees. She said they need 77 trees to be sure that by Christmas there would be at least one that Commander, their German shepherd, hadn't urinated on.

North Korean leader Kim Jong Un appeared with his 10-year-old daughter at what was said to be the launch of an ICBM. Analysts say the missile launch was Kim's warning to any boy who ever asked his daughter on a date.
It's Black Friday 2022, and holiday shopping deals are everywhere. Republicans say that President Biden's brain is 50% off, and the Justice Department is offering Donald Trump a free 30-day trial.
Today in New York City was the big Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. But Covid put a little damper on the festivities. The Dr. Fauci balloon vaccinated all the other balloons and they deflated.

Security agents at JFK Airport saw, in a baggage X-ray, a live cat that had stowed away inside a passenger's suitcase. When he was located, the owner of the suitcase said, "My flight's full and I'm in a middle seat. Can I trade places with the cat?"

Yesterday President Biden took part in the annual Thanksgiving Day tradition and pardoned two turkeys named Chocolate and Chip. You know what that means…Donald Trump completely wasted the 300 bucks he spent on that turkey disguise.

Customers of crypto exchange FTX are worried that they'll never see their money again. FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried says not to worry, all their cryptocurrency is securely stored on a blockchain in Hunter Biden's laptop.

Yesterday the Radio City Rockettes performed in their first Christmas Spectacular show of the season. Being in New York City, the Rockettes always kick extra high. That's because they're trying to get rid of the rats running across the stage.

Today a special counsel was appointed to oversee the criminal investigations into those classified documents at Mar-a-Lago. Apparently he's an expert in dealing with valuable documents. Like, also today, he was able to subpoena a pair of Taylor Swift tickets from Ticketmaster.
Last week, cryptocurrency exchange FTX filed for bankruptcy and its CEO resigned. On the plus side, at the annual cryptocurrency industry award show he's expected to win a lot of Ponzis.
Yesterday Donald Trump formally announced that he's running for president in 2024. His timing was perfect. Now on Thanksgiving, the Democrats will have something else to be thankful for.

A company in London broke a world record when 325 people cleaned pairs of sneakers at the same time. The previous record for sneaker cleaning was held by Adidas for erasing Kanye West's name off all its Yeezys.
Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, said that he'll give away most of his wealth during his lifetime. To prove it, he said he'll leave his wealth on a charity's front porch and take a picture of it.

Workers are busy decorating the Rockefeller Center Christmas tree in Manhattan. So before long, crowds of tourists will gaze up at that magnificent Norway spruce glowing with thousands of lights and then exclaim, "Hey, that guy stole my wallet!"

Officials in Nevada say it could take days to announce their election results. The problem is that in Las Vegas, a whole box of ballots disappeared when an election worker set it down next to David Copperfield.
KFC in Germany apologized after promoting crispy chicken as a way to commemorate Kristallnacht. KFC also expressed regret for describing their chicken as "Heil-Salutin' Good."
Today in Afghanistan, the Taliban banned women from entering all amusement parks. You know what the Taliban also said would not be allowed in amusement parks? Amusement.

A single ticket sold in California won a record $2 billion Powerball jackpot. According to California lottery officials, the winner can take the prize either as a lump-sum payment of $1 billion, or as three tanks of gas.
Tomorrow is Election Day 2022. And here's a public service reminder: In most states you have two ways—by mail and in person—two ways to claim an election was stolen.
Daylight Saving Time ends tonight, so don't forget to set your clocks back one hour. Also this year, because of inflation, don't forget to set your wallet back one hundred dollars.

A car company is urging owners of some Dodge vehicles to get their airbags fixed because they could explode and send shrapnel into the vehicle. To make sure car owners get the message, the company is also changing the name from "Dodge" to "Duck!"
A new book says that King Charles III had a valet who was in charge of squeezing toothpaste onto Charles’s monogrammed toothbrush. That's weird. A British guy who uses a toothbrush?
Joining the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade this year will be a new "Diary of a Wimpy Kid" balloon. And because it's New York City, also new this year will be the balloon "Bodyguard of a Wimpy Kid."

Elon Musk said he may allow people to be verified on Twitter for $8 a month. He also has other ideas how to increase revenue. For example, when Pat Sajak posts on Twitter, he'll have to pay $250 to buy a vowel.
It's Halloween, and people are celebrating in different ways. Like, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis says that if any trick-or-treaters come to his house, he'll fly them to Martha's Vineyard.
A 2,600-pound pumpkin in Minnesota is being carved into the world's largest jack-o'-lantern. The enormous, scary, orange thing is also expected to set a record for inspiring the most Trump jokes.

Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla, now also owns Twitter. Just think of the synergy. With Tesla's Autopilot, now it'll be even easier for people to send out tweets without paying attention to what they're doing.

Today a federal appeals court rejected Donald Trump's latest attempt to prevent Congress from getting his tax returns. The good news for Trump is, the court also ruled that his tax returns are eligible to win the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction.

Clorox is recalling some of its Pine Sol disinfectant cleaning products because they may contain infection-causing bacteria. Listen, if your disinfectant can cause an infection, you don’t need a recall, you need a dictionary.
Today Adidas ended production of all Yeezy-branded products because of Kanye West's anti-Semitic comments. They also canceled their big shopping promotion, "Have a Yeezy Hanukkah."
Yesterday two climate activists in a museum threw mashed potatoes on a painting by Monet, the French Impressionist. That makes no sense. Shouldn't they have thrown French fries?

Caesars Entertainment is proposing to build a casino in New York City's Times Square. They say you can play high-limit slot machines…high-limit blackjack…and for the ultimate in high-stakes gambling, you can take a ride on the subway.
According to a report, Elon Musk said that if he buys Twitter he'll fire 75% of its employees. The good news is, Donald Trump said he'd hire those employees to help him write 75% more tweets.
In an interview, Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle revealed that Prince Harry’s favorite fast food in America is In-N-Out. Then she added, "You know, in and out, like Prime Minister Liz Truss."
Yesterday Chicago had its earliest first snowfall in eight years. But Chicago residents carried on as usual. Sixteen snowmen were mugged.
Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott just gave $85 million to Girl Scouts of the USA. When asked for comment she explained, "I really wanted that last box of Peanut Butter Do-si-dos."
The sequel film "Terrifier 2" is causing some moviegoers to vomit and faint in theaters. Apparently people are horrified by graphic and disturbing scenes of Donald Trump returning to Twitter.

Doctors in Italy successfully performed brain surgery while the patient remained awake and played the saxophone. The doctors removed a tumor that was causing a debilitating condition known as "malignant Kenny G."

The second largest supermarket chain in the U.S., Kroger, is buying the fourth largest, Albertsons, for $25 billion. It usually costs more to buy a supermarket chain but Kroger had 86 million coupons.

Today Netflix announced that its new, more affordable subscription plan where they show you advertising will cost $6.99 a month. But they said the price drops to only 99 cents if they also show you Adam Sandler movies.

Two fishermen are accused of stuffing fish with lead weights to win thousands of dollars in an Ohio fishing tournament. Officials became suspicious because they thought Kramer tried that on an episode of "Seinfeld."

A new report says that, out of 10 fast-food restaurant chains, the fastest drive-thru time is at Taco Bell. Which makes sense because the food at Taco Bell is also the fastest at driving thru your colon.
Kanye West was locked out of his Twitter and Instagram accounts for posting anti-Semitic messages. In his defense, he said he was trying out lyrics for the new album he's recording with Mel Gibson.

Yesterday the White House clarified that President Biden's warning about a nuclear 'Armageddon' was not based on new intelligence. President Biden agreed, explaining that nothing he says is based on having any intelligence.
A man at a U.S-Canadian border crossing was charged with smuggling three Burmese pythons in his pants. He got really upset. He was hoping he'd be charged with having four pythons in his pants.

The U.S. government is taking legal steps to limit the amount of space junk--the cloud of dangerous debris orbiting the Earth. There's a lot of it, but experts agree that the worst piece of space junk is "Star Wars: Episode Nine — The Rise of Skywalker."
A British gardener earned a Guinness World Record for growing a 56-inch-long leek. Officials say it's the longest leek since that time Brett Kavanaugh hit a porta-potty at Oktoberfest.

To streamline the monarchy, Queen Margrethe II of Denmark announced that four of her grandchildren will no longer be known as princes or princesses, but instead as counts and countesses. And Danish counts and countesses will be known as Danish pastries.

Reality star Kim Kardashian is paying a $1.2 million fine after being accused of a cryptocurrency scheme in a class-action lawsuit. Which is unusual because it's the first time a Kardashian has ever been accused of anything to do with class.

Vladimir Putin announced that Russia annexed four regions in Ukraine, claiming that residents there voted to join Russia. But apparently there's some controversy about the vote in Donetsk: Donald Trump says he won.
Now streaming on Disney+, the movie "Hocus Pocus 2." It's about how the New York Attorney General describes Donald Trump's financial statements.
Today three Russian cosmonauts returned safely from a mission to the International Space Station. Then they heard that Putin might draft them and they caught the next rocket back up.
A new study says that dogs can smell when somebody is under a lot of stress. The study was conducted with Donald Trump's terrier, Vladimir Putin's Pekingese, and Alec Baldwin's Boxerdoodle.

The world's number one chess player, Magnus Carlsen, has accused another player of cheating. Chess experts say the situation isn't black-and-white. It's black-and-white-and-black-and-white-and-black-and-white.
Tonight a NASA spacecraft will crash into an asteroid. But some observers are concerned. They say that if the spacecraft took off from Florida, it might crash into Martha's Vineyard.

According to a teacher, a school in Kentucky is "infested" after a snake and a mouse fell from classroom ceilings. The good news is, now the school is teaching 4 Rs: reading, 'riting, reptiles, and rodents.

Tonight Elton John will be performing at the White House. To support President Biden's climate policies he'll be singing "Bennie and the Teslas," "Don't Let the Sun Go Down on My Solar Panel," and "Energy-Efficient LED Bulb In The Wind."

Today social media videos showed long lines of cars at border checkpoints trying to leave Russia. Vladimir Putin dismissed the videos, saying that those people were all in line to see Queen Elizabeth II's coffin.

Today a lot of Russians tried to buy plane tickets out of Russia so they won't have to fight in Ukraine. They want to leave so bad, they're like, "Hey, Ron DeSantis, any seats left? We'll fly anywhere. Martha's Vineyard…Delaware…"

An executive at food company Beyond Meat has been accused of biting a man’s nose in a fight. In his defense, the executive said it was all to promote Beyond Meat's newest product: nasal cartilage burgers.
An Idaho man broke a Guinness World Record by riding a unicycle for 30 miles while juggling. No word on what he was juggling, but I think we can rule out multiple girlfriends.

The Japanese emperor and other world leaders will be riding to Queen Elizabeth's funeral on a bus. And this is a surprise: Also on the bus, thanks to Ron DeSantis, will be 50 illegal immigrants from Venezuela.
Tomorrow in Brooklyn is the third annual BagelFest, a celebration of New York's iconic food item. Some people think bagels are great. Other people think a bagel is a big zero.

The newest Victoria's Secret model is professional race car driver Toni Breidinger. She'd be great in their fashion show: She's attractive, she's confident, and she and her pit crew can change her bustier 8 times in 6 seconds.
King Charles III wants to reduce the financial burden of the monarchy on the U.K. In fact, to earn some income, the Beefeaters just signed a sponsorship deal with Hamburger Helper.
A new study says that math and reading scores for America’s 9-year-olds fell during the pandemic. On the bright side, the study says that 9-year-olds got perfect scores for reading "N" and "95."
A man in China was found safe after he was trapped up in the sky in a hydrogen balloon for two days. Even worse, flying in a hydrogen balloon right next to him was a crying baby.

Today former President Obama and former first lady Michelle Obama returned to the White House for the unveiling of their official portraits. Later, President Biden went to the FBI for the unveiling of former President Trump's official Wanted poster.

NASA's James Webb Space Telescope captured its first direct images of a planet beyond our solar system. The planet appears to have 12 times the mass of Jupiter, but you know the expression, the space camera adds 10 masses of Jupiter.
Premiering this week on Disney+ is the new "Pinocchio" movie. But they've updated it a little bit. In this version, instead of his nose, every time Pinocchio tells a lie his Twitter followers grow.
Animal cookies sold at Target are being recalled because they may contain pieces of metal. Here's what happened: Before they made some of the animal cookies, they forgot to take off the leash.

Today NASA delayed the launch of its Artemis 1 moon rocket. And unfortunately, NASA says the next moon rocket flight will probably also be delayed because it's scheduled to depart from LaGuardia Airport.
On Monday NASA plans to launch the most powerful rocket ever assembled from Kennedy Space Center. Engineers say the rocket will leave Florida faster than a box of documents from Mar-a-Lago.

Today researchers said that President Biden's student loan cancellation program would cost $600 billion over the next ten years. To put that in perspective, the only other thing in education that costs $600 billion is an economics textbook.

The Oregon Geographic Names Board is changing the name of a mountain in Oregon that refers to a symbol of the Nazi Party--Swastika Mountain. They also told the Ku Klux Klan that next on the list is Mount Hood.

Senator Mitch McConnell called President Biden’s decision to cancel some student debt “a slap in the face to working Americans.” McConnell said the decision is so bad it's like working Americans told a joke about Will Smith's wife.

The National Archives identified over 100 documents with classified markings in the first 15 boxes they got from Mar-a-Lago. That's unbelievable. Inside his private residence, Donald Trump actually had some reading material?
Over the weekend, nine people were arrested after they caused a panic at the Kentucky State Fair. Authorities say they'll be charged with disturbing the peace and disorderly corndog.

Because of concerns about E. coli, Wendy’s removed the romaine lettuce from its sandwiches in four states. Wendy's patrons applauded the move, saying that it will help protect them from eating a vegetable.

Officials are telling New Yorkers that if they see a spotted lanternfly they should kill it. Which explains why Party City stores in New York are all sold out of cockroach costumes, size extra-extra-small.
Recently the U.S. Army announced prototypes for the bra that it’s calling the "Army Tactical Brassiere." For security reasons, the prototypes are classified Victoria's Top Secret.
Today the director of the CDC said the organization's Covid-19 performance "did not reliably meet expectations." She said that's why she's changing the CDC to a C-, a D-, and an F.

A new study in The Lancet says that people who have close contact with their pets can give them monkeypox. And dogs are like, "So, just for now, instead of man's best friend, can we be more like man's casual acquaintance?"
Three men just broke a world record by traveling to all 50 states in five days. They did it by hiding in a piece of checked luggage on an American Airlines flight from New York to LA.
This week, poliovirus was detected in wastewater samples in New York City. The good news is the poliovirus didn't get very far because it was immediately mugged by the coronavirus and monkeypox.

The search warrant for former President Trump's Mar-a-Lago home shows that the FBI recovered 11 sets of classified documents. In his defense, Trump said that "classified documents" means that he "made the documents classy."

Today in Germany, 31 people were injured on a roller coaster at a Legoland amusement park. But everybody’s okay because park officials quickly took the roller coaster apart and used the pieces to build a hospital.
A Kansas man convicted of performing illegal autopsies has been fined more than $700,000. $700,000 for illegal autopsies! That’s a stiff punishment.
Today the FBI executed a search warrant at former President Trump's home, Mar-a-Lago. Some good news for Trump, though: they actually found those 11,000 votes he was looking for in Georgia.

The Casper mattress company is looking to hire people with "exceptional sleeping ability" to demonstrate its mattresses. "Exceptional sleeping ability"...so basically they're looking for people who don't watch the news.

A CDC study said that last summer dozens of people got sick from bacteria and the norovirus at a splash park in Kansas. But splash park officials say the water is safe this year because heat waves and global warming boiled it.
Fashion company Balenciaga is selling the world's most expensive garbage bag; it costs almost $1,800. So finally lazy people can have the perfect excuse not to take out the trash.

Insiders say that Warner Bros. canceled "Batgirl" so it can write the movie off as a tax loss. Which makes sense because in the movie's origin story, the future Batgirl is bitten by a radioactive accountant.

A new report says that home affordability in the U.S. is the worst it's been since 1989. On the plus side, an affordable house just became vacant in a nice neighborhood in Kabul, Afghanistan. Needs some repairs. No balcony.
French's teamed up with a New York bakery to create a mustard doughnut. They say the mustard doughnut is perfect for dessert lovers looking for a fun new way to induce vomiting.

A passenger who flew into Darwin Airport in Australia was fined over $1,800 after a police dog found two McMuffins in his bag. To put that in perspective, $1,800 is also what two McMuffins cost at the airport McDonald's.
Today President Biden tested positive for Covid-19 again, in a “rebound” case of Covid. The president is in good spirits, though, because he forgot he had Covid the first time.

Because of supply-chain issues, Hershey says it won't be able to deliver enough candy for Halloween. You can tell they feel bad about it because they're renaming their Jolly Rancher candy Subdued and Apologetic Rancher.
Today JetBlue Airways agreed to buy Spirit Airlines for $3.8 billion. JetBlue would have paid only $3.0 billion but it also wanted to check two suitcases.
A Nebraska man broke a Guinness World Record by throwing an ax into a target 90 feet away. The Guinness judge agreed to approve the record really fast because he was sitting only 80 feet away.
A young bear walked up to a mall in Georgia and tried to open several locked doors. Officials say the bear apparently came to the mall to make a stuffed doll at Build-A-Human.

According to his doctor, President Biden is now almost completely free of Covid-19 symptoms. But the president is really worried because now an important member of his inner circle is out with Covid--his teleprompter.

This weekend, the Newport Folk Festival has a stage that's being powered by festival-goers on stationary bicycles. And for emergencies, the festival also has an automated heart defibrillator powered by harmonicas.
According to his doctor, last night President Biden's temperature was 99.4. President Biden was thrilled. Finally there's a number measuring how well he's doing that isn't in the 30s.
This morning President Biden tested positive for Covid-19. The good news is he probably won't get Covid because the test results have to be approved by Joe Manchin.
Coming to theaters this Friday is the movie "Nope." It's about Senator Joe Manchin voting on President Biden's agenda.

Today NASCAR announced that in July 2023 it'll hold its first-ever street race through downtown Chicago. That makes sense. With everything happening there, the only way to get through Chicago safely is to go 200 miles an hour.

The government’s top infectious disease expert, Dr. Anthony Fauci, says he plans to retire by the end of President Biden’s current term. And to make sure he stays retired, Dr. Fauci says that every six months he'll announce a booster retirement.
A new lawsuit claims that Skittles candy contains a "known toxin" that is "unfit for human consumption." The same lawsuit also claims that Butterfinger candy contains an actual human thumb.

Three times in the last year, a Florida man has found a live iguana in his toilet bowl. When asked for comment, the man said he doesn't know how the iguanas got there, then went back to eating his dinner of live iguanas.
A new CNBC poll says that President Biden’s overall approval rating has fallen to an all-time low. Also at an all-time low is the approval rating President Biden gives to CNBC polls.
Yesterday the Webb Space Telescope sent back some amazing images. To NASA it sent photos of a planetary nebula. And to Instagram it sent photos of a plate of sushi it had for lunch.
Today Mattel unveiled a new Barbie doll that looks like primatologist Jane Goodall. It's the perfect gift for the aspiring primatologist in your family or for your pet chimp.

A government study says that most people in the U.S. have a controversial weed-killing chemical in their urine. On the plus side, that means most people will never have to worry about birth control if they have sex with the Jolly Green Giant.

Next week a New York restaurant will be selling the world's most expensive French fries, a $200 plate of French fries. It's perfect for people who love eating a plate of French fries but wish there was another way it could be bad for you.
Today six people were injured in Pamplona, Spain, at the running of the bulls. When asked for comment, six bulls said they had a really great time at this year's running of the people.

According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, there are still almost twice as many job openings as there are available workers. That's about 11 million job openings, not including the one at 10 Downing Street.
Today NASA restored contact with its $33 million spacecraft headed for the moon. The bad news is, the first message that the spacecraft sent back said that NASA's car warranty was about to expire.

Because of salmonella outbreaks, the CDC is warning people not to "kiss or snuggle" backyard poultry like ducks and chickens. Apparently prices are getting so high that some people were doing anything to get free eggs.

Today President Biden is hosting a Fourth of July barbecue at the White House and giving a speech. And this is interesting: Biden says he wrote the speech about the Declaration of Independence using the very same quill pen he loaned to Thomas Jefferson.
Air New Zealand is adding six sleeping pods stacked up like bunk beds to some of its airliners. The sleeping pods will be available in three sizes: Regular, Full-Size, and Mile High Club.
It's the Fourth of July weekend. So if you love to see lots of fireworks and explosions, just go to the airport and watch people when they hear their flights are canceled.

Two women were arrested at a Bangkok airport after 109 live animals were found in their two suitcases. On the bright side, airline officials said the animals had more room in the suitcases than they would have had in economy class.
An Idaho man broke a Guinness World Record by walking 3.4 miles while balancing a guitar on his chin. But this is weird--then Guinness gave him an expensive new guitar, with no strings attached.

A team of domino artists in Michigan broke a Guinness World Record by building a wall out of more than 50,000 dominoes. The team said the best way to keep a big wall of dominoes from falling apart is to keep the Supreme Court away from it.

At a pageant in California, a Chinese crested-chihuahua mix was crowned the World's Ugliest Dog. The judges said the dog is so ugly that when other dogs come up to him they don't know which end to sniff.
Because of a fire risk, over 400,000 patio umbrellas sold at Costco have been recalled. The good news is, Costco says that's only one package of umbrellas.

Yesterday Toyota announced that it's recalling its first mainstream electric car because the wheels can fall off. Company officials say that on the plus side, if the car has no wheels and can't move, it'll stay charged forever.

This week we'll be able to see a very rare event, five planets lining up in the sky--Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn. To put it in perspective, that event is as rare as the Senate approving a new gun law.
Kraft Macaroni and Cheese is shortening its name to Kraft Mac & Cheese. The shorter name is perfect for people who want to think even less about what they're shoveling into their piehole.

Today Kellogg announced that it will separate into three different companies. Breakfast cereal insiders say the separation resulted from the bad breakup of a love triangle between Snap, Crackle, and Pop.
A fisherman in Cambodia caught what researchers say is the world’s largest freshwater fish. As opposed to the world's smallest freshwater fish, which was received as an entrée at Long John Silver's.
He's okay, but this morning in Delaware, President Biden fell off his bicycle. He said he was having trouble getting it out of first gear...you know, like his presidency.
Cosmetics maker Revlon has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in the U.S. Actually, instead of just going with Chapter 11, it used its own Volumazing Mascara and filed for Chapter 11111111111.

New York City cancelled all swimming classes this summer because of the national lifeguard shortage. The good news is, former NY governor Andrew Cuomo offered to teach female swimmers mouth-to-mouth resuscitation.
Gas in some places is over $5 a gallon. Gas is so expensive that now Uber has three service tiers: UberX, Uber Pool, and Uber Piggyback.
Coca-Cola and the maker of Jack Daniels whiskey are coming out with a Jack and Coke canned cocktail. It's perfect for people who love Jack and Cokes but are too drunk to remember the ingredients.

The Rolling Stones had to postpone a concert today when Mick Jagger tested positive for Covid-19. It's really his own fault he got Covid-19. He said when he heard "19" he just had to have sex with it.

A new study says that adults who share their beds with a partner have more restful sleep. That's why Beautyrest is running a special promotion: every new mattress now includes the mattress salesperson.

Today the CDC announced that the symptoms of monkeypox look different than they have in the past. The CDC's lovable spokesmonkey made the announcement in his new book, "Curious George and the Man with the Yellow Rash."
Thanks for the mention, Lianna! I hope my book helped and the process was fun.
A Missouri woman was infected with an STD when she had sex in a car insured by Geico and now Geico may have to pay her over $5 million. "I should have gotten us a motel room," said the Geico Gecko.

Researchers are warning that an insect called the spotted lanternfly could spread to California by 2027 and eat the grapes used to make wine. On the plus side, if the lanternflies get into the wine they can help push the cork out of the bottle.

A new survey says that, compared to before Covid-19, fewer Americans are leaving tips for restaurant servers now. When they heard about the survey, Americans took it with a grain of salt, then added either 15%, 20%, or 25% of a grain of salt.
The Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in Cleveland has a new exhibit about the Beatles. The exhibit will run through March 2023 or until Yoko Ono shows up.

Yesterday the White House announced tough new sanctions on Russian friends of Vladimir Putin and their yachts. Which is why Russian oligarchs are cruising around on a new kind of watercraft: the super-dinghy.

Today 388 people in Britain put on mermaid tails to break the record for the world's largest gathering of merfolk. So from the waist down they looked like fish, and from the waist up they looked like losers.

To celebrate the Platinum Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II this week, an official dessert was selected, a lemon-flavored trifle. There was an awkward moment when the Queen offered Prince Charles a taste but then made him wait for it.

At a recent auction, an almost 6-foot-tall bottle of Scotch whiskey sold for about $1.4 million. To put that in perspective, $1.4 million was also the winning bid for a six-inch-tall bottle of baby formula.
Next week Tom Cruise will turn 60 but he's still going strong. In fact, he just announced he'll star in the sequel to Top Gun: Maverick--Top Gun: Medicare.
This week the "Star Wars" series "Obi-Wan Kenobi" premieres on Disney Plus. But before you get too excited, there's also a series with Jar Jar Binks coming to Disney Minus.
Hyundai is recalling over 200,000 cars because their seat belts can explode. In their defense, company officials said the feature is a fast, easy way to lose a few pounds.
Today the CDC said there are four more suspected cases of monkeypox in the U. S. But they also said not to worry: Monkeypox becomes much less aggressive if it's injected with a dose of bananapox.
Tomorrow, May 22, is Sherlock Holmes Day. Nobody knows who first started celebrating Sherlock Holmes Day, but he's a left-handed, bald, bagpipe player who walks with a limp.
Health officials are investigating a possible monkeypox infection in New York City. So if you see somebody in New York City throwing his feces at people like a monkey, he may have monkeypox.

Today at a London theater, Tom Cruise joined Prince William and Kate for the U.K. premiere of the new "Top Gun" movie. They all made royal entrances. Prince William escorted Kate down the red carpet and Tom Cruise rode in on one of the Queen's Corgis.

A bullet hole in a picture of Johnny Cash on a water tower in Arkansas makes it look like the country music singer is urinating. It's pretty embarrassing. Officials say the water tower is leaking faster than a draft opinion from the Supreme Court.
Officials are tightening the rules on concession prices at New York City-area airports after they found one bar at LaGuardia charging $27 for a beer. It was a Boston lager: Scam Adams.
Over the weekend, an Idaho man broke a Guinness World Record by running a half marathon while wearing 111 T-shirts. By the end of the race he was sweating more than Vladimir Putin's food taster.
Yesterday was National Blame Someone Else Day. I was all set to write a great joke about it yesterday but Elon Musk distracted me.

Today Elon Musk put his deal to buy Twitter "temporarily on hold" because he's concerned about the number of fake accounts. He said he could tell some accounts were fake because their tweets actually made well-supported points in a calm and respectful manner.

This week NASA said that the James Webb Space Telescope has achieved perfect optical alignment. Apparently that involved focusing the telescope on a distant galaxy and asking it "Which is better? This?...Or this?...This?...Or this?
Until recently North Korea claimed it had a perfect record in keeping out the coronavirus. But on Thursday North Korea reported its first coronavirus infection. Kim Jong Unhappy.

Yesterday a former chemist for Coca-Cola was sentenced to 14 years in prison for stealing trade secrets for China. The Pentagon was very concerned. Apparently the Chinese were developing a powerful new missile propelled by Diet Coke and Mentos.

New data shows that so far this year, New Yorkers have called in over 7,000 rat sightings to the city’s complaint line. Even worse, over 6,000 of those times the rats grabbed the phone to take a selfie.

A new study says that take-out coffee cups could be releasing trillions of plastic nanoparticles into your coffee. Even worse than the nanoparticles, Starbucks coffee cups could be releasing trillions of Tall-, Grande-, and Venti-particles.

The search goes on for that escaped Alabama prison inmate and his corrections officer girlfriend. He's 6-foot-9 but she's only 5-foot-5. Authorities suspect that tomorrow she'll be at the Kentucky Derby riding on him.

A woman at a Goodwill store in Texas bought a statue for $35 that turned out to be an ancient Roman bust. Experts say it's the most well-preserved ancient bust they've seen since Cher's last concert tour.
Today is May the Fourth, Star Wars Day. To mark the occasion, Dave Chappelle and his security team beat the crap out of Jar Jar Binks.
Today in the U.S., it's National Teacher Appreciation Day. I know, that's a long word. Just sound it out. Uh...pree...shee...AY...shun. Can anybody tell me what that means? Anybody?

Tonight is the Met Gala fundraiser, where all the celebrities show up in fancy outfits. But this year the red carpet will be a little different because of Covid vaccines. Instead of "Who are you wearing?" the big question will be "Who are you injecting?"

Nike is selling non-fungible tokens of some virtual sneakers for more than $100,000. The Nike NFTs are perfect for people who have $100,000 for a pair of sneakers but don't have enough room in their home for a shoebox.

Today in New York City, officials at the Bronx Zoo announced the birth of a rare baby tree kangaroo. The rare baby kangaroo is so valuable that it's already been pickpocketed out of its mother's pouch.

Wildlife officials in Colorado said a bear broke into a car and destroyed the interior to get a tube of lip gloss. The officials advise that any hikers who accidentally encounter the bear should pucker up.
Tropicana unveiled a cereal that's designed to be eaten with orange juice instead of milk. It's perfect for people who love cereal but are sick and tired of milk's smug, entitled attitude.

In the state of Washington, firefighters rescued a woman who fell into a pit toilet where she had dropped her cellphone. When asked why she would go after a communication device that's so full of crap, she replied, "Well, Elon Musk bought Twitter."

Florida Governor Ron DeSantis suggested that he may do more to limit the Walt Disney Company’s ability to run its own government. For example, he said that from now on, the Little Mermaid would be working for the Orlando Water Department as a sewer inspector.

In a letter yesterday, the Tony Awards told attendees that it has a "strict no violence policy." Apparently the policy is so strict, actors now have to tell each other "Be careful so you don't break a leg."
It's Earth Day 2022, and a lot of people really stepped up to protect the environment. Like, today Will Smith slapped a Styrofoam coffee cup.

Video released today by TMZ shows champion boxer Mike Tyson repeatedly punching a fellow airline passenger in the face. Tyson said it's his version of joining the Mile High Club, where "getting lucky" means you don't get a fractured skull.
The news media is still full of appalling reports of intense fighting, violence, and bloodshed with little chance of a ceasefire. Yes, I'm talking about the Johnny Depp-Amber Heard lawsuit.

Because of a judge's ruling yesterday, many U.S. airlines no longer require their passengers to wear masks. Passengers are thrilled because instead of masks now they can focus on having fistfights about the luggage bins, armrests, and reclining seats.

Dollar Tree is recalling more than a million hot glue guns because they can malfunction. And some people are pretty angry about it. In fact, Martha Stewart said, "You can have my hot glue gun when you pry it from my cold, dead hands that I've hot-glued it to."
The FDA said it's looking into reports that Lucky Charms cereal causes gastrointestinal issues in some consumers. Even the Lucky Charms leprechaun referred to the cereal as "magically diarrhetic."

On Monday, for the first time in three years, the White House will host its Easter Egg Roll. And as a special treat, this year guests will also be able to search for Easter eggs hidden in Hunter Biden's laptop.
A new survey says that dogs who are on a vegan diet may be healthier. The survey also says that vegan dogs are better at doing tricks like "shake hands," "roll over," and "act superior."

According to the U.S. military, in 2014 an interstellar meteor collided with Earth for the first time ever. Officials said the Earth's inhabitants got very lucky because Michael Bay didn't make a movie about it.
A new study in the Journal of Headache and Pain says that headaches are more common in women than in men. Here's how the study was conducted: the male researchers asked their wives to have sex.

An Idaho man set a Guinness World Record by balancing a lawn mower on his chin for over 30 minutes. Even with a lawnmower on his chin, experts say his face was safer than if he had told a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith.
Yesterday Jennifer Lopez announced that she just got engaged to Ben Affleck for the second time. So instead of "Bennifer," the new nickname for the celebrity couple is "Benn-there-done-that-ifer."

Today the Academy banned Will Smith from the Oscars for 10 years, saying it was to protect the safety of their performers and guests. They said they would have banned him for 15 years, but at least before he slapped Chris Rock he used Purell.
National Park Service rangers are warning that a rare virus in Utah is killing wild cottontail rabbits. The good news is all the new career opportunities listed on Indeed.​com for Easter bunnies.

According to a new study, having lots of trees in your neighborhood could improve your health and lower your medical costs. Here's why: If you have a lot of trees around you, it's harder for Will Smith to slap you.

West Virginia University officials said that a donkey and 93 sheep escaped from a research farm but were quickly rounded up. Then they said it actually might have been more but the person counting the sheep got to 93 and started snoring.

Yesterday the Taliban announced a ban on growing narcotics in Afghanistan, which is the world's biggest opium producer. No more drugs in Afghanistan? That's really going to hurt their Spring Break business.
Some Disney-brand hand sanitizers are being recalled because they contain a human carcinogen. On the bright side, finally here's a news story about hands and danger that doesn't involve Will Smith.
It's April Fools' Day. To celebrate, Will Smith slapped Chris Rock in the face wearing a hand buzzer.
At the Academy Awards, Will Smith slapped Chris Rock on the face with his hand. And this is even weirder: Hollywood agents get 10%, so after the show Chris Rock slapped his agent with one finger.
The Academy of Motion Pictures said that in a few weeks they'll decide what to do about Will Smith. He expects a slap on the wrist and they expect a slap in the face.

Yesterday "King Richard" Oscar-winner Will Smith apologized to Chris Rock for slapping him in the face at the Academy Awards. Smith also apologized to Venus and Serena Williams for not following-through on his forehand.
At the Academy Awards last night, Will Smith slapped Chris Rock hard in the face. It must have really hurt. In fact later, when Will Smith got handed his Oscar for "King Richard," the Oscar flinched.
According to Reuters, sanctions are really hurting the Russian economy. Things are so bad that to save money commuting to work, some Russian oligarchs are yacht-pooling.

This week a woman in Ohio called 911 to report that her order from KFC didn't contain enough pieces of chicken. Here's a tip: If you want to call 911 to complain that you didn't get enough pieces of chicken, maybe you're just too dumb to count them correctly.
Today is National Cocktail Day, a holiday for celebrating alcoholic drinks. Which is perfect, because today is also National Watching the News Day.

Hotels in Venice, Italy, are giving their guests water guns to chase away aggressive seagulls. On the plus side, thanks to the seagulls, the hotel says that every pizza comes with a free extra topping.
According to CBS News, the global shortage of computer chips could last for years. That's why Apple's newest addition to the iMac family of desktops is the iAbacus.
A British restaurant was cleaning up, sweeping the floor, and found a full set of dentures. You know what that means...British food is so bad that some customer's teeth made a run for it.
A new Covid variant, the BA.2 variant, is spreading across the U.S., one state after the next. Experts say the good news is, it probably won't travel too much farther because it can't afford the gas.

A biotech company is offering to pay people money if they donate their poop for research. They said they'd pay for the poop with a new type of bitcoin that's called exactly what you think you'd call bitcoin paid for poop.
Today is St. Patrick's Day 2022, and everybody's talking about those elusive little creatures jealously guarding the pots of gold they've hidden away. Not leprechauns...Russian oligarchs.

In New York City today, somebody stole 400 bulletproof vests that were going to be shipped to Ukraine. But Ukrainians are like, "You live in New York City? Keep the vests. You need them more than we do."

A 13-year-old British girl broke a Guinness World Record by assembling a Mr. Potato Head toy in under 6 seconds. Which is weird, because it took her 6 days to assemble Mr. Potato Head's IKEA bunk bed.

According to Reuters, there may be a worldwide shortage of diesel fuel. Fuel oil inventories have dropped by tens of millions of barrels. Apparently the reason is that some Russian oligarch just filled up his yacht.
Daylight Savings Time starts tonight. So don't forget to set your clock ahead one hour. Or you could do it like Vladimir Putin and just steal somebody else's clock.

Yesterday actor Jussie Smollett was sentenced to 150 days in jail and now he's in a cell monitored by security cameras and by an officer wearing a body camera. Or as his agent put it, "Now that the trial is behind him, Jussie is happy to be in front of the cameras again."

An auction house is selling the Tin Man's oil can from "The Wizard of Oz." Bidding starts at $200,000, but if you want to spend $200,000 on a metal container that holds petroleum products, you could also buy a used car and fill the gas tank.
Today is National Meatball Day. It's the favorite holiday of people who love Swedish meatballs, Italian meatballs, and the Heimlich maneuver.

Today McDonald's said it's closing all its restaurants in Russia because of Ukraine. Is that a good idea? If McDonald's really wants to hurt the Russians it should open up more restaurants, hand out free artery-clogging fries and Big Macs, attack the Russians from the inside.
A Polish man broke a Guinness World Record by spending 3 hours and 28 minutes with his body submerged in ice. He said it's the only way he can cool off after thinking about Vladimir Putin.
Today North Korea launched its second ballistic missile in less than a week. You know what that means...nominations are now open for the 2022 People's Choice Psychopathic Dictator Awards.

Astronomers say that a 3-ton piece of space junk crashed into the moon today at over 5,000 mph. And the Moon is like, "That’s okay, Earth, I'll take the hit from the crashing space junk. You have enough problems already."

Today a man in New York City lost his wallet containing $4,000 cash but then the wallet was returned to him with the $4,000 still there. The bad news is, the wallet was empty later after he gassed up his car.
Fitness company Fitbit is recalling 1.7 million smartwatches because their batteries can overheat. In their defense, Fitbit officials pointed out that their slogan is "Feel the burn."

Today Russian athletes were banned from competing in international ice skating, skiing, track, and other sports. They're sad and depressed because now they won't be doing something they love...Not the athletes, their dope dealers.

Yesterday President Biden nominated the first Black woman to the Supreme Court, saying the court should look like America. To look more like America, he also told the Supreme Court justices that they each have to pack on about eighty pounds.

A Nova Scotia teenager set a Guinness World Record by solving 211 Rubik's cubes while bouncing on a pogo stick. The classmate who taught him exactly what you have to do to solve Rubik's cubes described him as "really gullible."

A report from the American Dental Association says there's a shortage of dental hygienists in the United States. It's bad news but the report doesn't sugarcoat it because, well, it's the American Dental Association.
Yesterday was Twosday, and in North Carolina a baby girl was born on 2/22/2022, at 2:22 a.m. And to make it even more perfect, right as the baby was born, she made a Number 2.

Today is Twosday, Tuesday, 2/22/22. It’s the perfect day for those weird people who like things in pairs. Today is Twosday, Tuesday, 2/22/22. It’s the perfect day for those weird people who like things in pairs.

Today racehorse Medina Spirit was stripped of its win in last year's Kentucky Derby because of testing positive for a banned substance. The good news is, Medina Spirit was just named official mascot of the Russian Olympic team.

Family Dollar issued a recall of some products after more than a thousand rodents were found in one of its distribution facilities. No word yet on what products they're recalling, but I'm guessing defective mousetraps.

Today officials in London warned residents to stay home because of Britain's worst storm in decades. Boris Johnson said the wind was so strong it actually picked up 100 of his friends and dropped them into a party at 10 Downing Street.

According to new reports, Russia is moving a field hospital to the Ukraine border. But Vladimir Putin says not to worry, the field hospital won't be used to invade Ukraine. It's for treating accidental drug overdoses by Russian Olympic athletes.

Today at the Winter Olympics, Team Canada won the gold medal in the men’s 5000-meter short track speed skating relay. Even more impressive, to win the race they had to skate around 47 Canadian truck drivers sitting on the ice.

Olympian gymnast Simone Biles and NFL player Jonathan Owens just got engaged. They said they fell head over heels in love, although in Biles's case it was head over heels over head over heels over head then a double salto layout with a half-twist and she stuck the landing.

To be sure it's still working, get a booster shot. Even kids should get a booster shot. That's what the experts are saying. Not health experts talking about the Covid vaccine, Russian Olympic figure skating coaches talking about trimetazidine.

A new Labor Department report says that last month saw the biggest annual increase in inflation in 40 years. If you'd like to read the report,the Labor Dept. is selling it for $19.95...Sorry,here's an update...that's $49.95...Wait...actually,you better send them all your money.

Today General Motors had to cancel two shifts at one of its factories because of a parts shortage caused by those protests at the Canadian border. A shortage of parts is also the reason Cher had to cancel two plastic surgeries.

The medal ceremony for team figure skating at the Beijing Winter Games was canceled because a Russian skater reportedly tested positive for a banned drug. That's hard to believe. A medal-winning Russian Olympic athlete tested positive for only one banned drug?

Israeli scientists have successfully taught goldfish how to drive a small fish tank around on land to get a reward of fish food. Elon Musk immediately sued the scientists, claiming that's how Tesla's Autopilot works.

Yesterday U.S. Secret Service officials arrested a Home Depot employee accused of passing nearly $400,000 in counterfeit money. The arrest came after the Home Depot employee said he couldn't answer questions about the counterfeit money because he doesn't work in that department.

Today the FBI urged U.S. Olympic athletes to use burner phones while they're at the Olympics in China, for security reasons. No comment from the two Olympic mascots: a lantern child, Shuey Rhon Rhon, and a lovable panda, Cyber Hacker Hacker.

Today the Pentagon said it believes Russia might be planning an elaborate hoax as an excuse to invade Ukraine.Vladimir Putin said his troops can't invade because they're way too busy filling an order that Ukraine just placed on Amazon for two-day delivery of 10,000 Russian tanks.

Today is Groundhog Day, and Punxsutawney Phil came out of his burrow and predicted six more weeks of winter. And as a bonus this year, he also predicted six more weeks of suspension from "The View" for Whoopi Goldberg.

Tesla is recalling over 50,000 cars because their “Full Self-Driving” software lets them roll through stop signs. Officials explained that a feature of the software causes the car to disregard some traffic laws if the driver resembles Tiger Woods.
Today Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced that he has contracted Covid-19. But this is nice: Because his coronavirus is Canadian, it politely apologized.

According to U.S. officials, Russia has prepared to invade Ukraine by moving blood supplies to the Ukraine border. The blood would be used to treat the wounded and to provide nourishment to Vladimir Putin's personal battalion of undead troops from Transylvania.
There's a new White House pet, a short-haired cat named Willow. Between all the napping, getting groomed, and wandering around aimlessly, President Biden hasn't had the time to meet the cat yet.

This week was the birthday of Volodymyr Zelensky, the president of Ukraine. He had a pretty memorable party. A huge birthday cake was wheeled in, and after everybody finished singing "Happy Birthday," out of the cake jumped 100,000 Russian soldiers.

This week drugstores like CVS and Walgreens will be handing out free N95 masks. Their risk-averse customers are pretty happy about it. Now they can wear the face masks and be 95% protected from being identified while they're shoplifting.

A man in India broke a world record by doing 109 pushups with his fingertips in one minute. The bad news is, he works in tech support, so that means he can also disconnect 109 customer phone calls in a minute.

The Rite Aid drugstore chain is closing one of its Manhattan stores because of too much shoplifting. Rite Aid officials said the decision to close was a bitter pill to swallow but it got rid of a headache and anything else would have been a Band-Aid solution.

This week President Biden was criticized for suggesting that the U.S. wouldn't respond aggressively to a “minor incursion” by Russia into Ukraine. When asked to clarify, Biden said it would be okay for Russian troops to cross the border "to retrieve a Frisbee."

McDonald's is selling a dessert, a sweet pastry filled with blueberries and vanilla-flavored crème and baked in a pie crust. It's to improve customer retention: If their customers get fat enough, they won't be able to leave McDonald's through the door.
