Simone Biles has officially secured a spot on the U.S. Gymnastics team for next month's Olympics. She was so happy she was doing cartwheels. Which raises the question, How can you possibly know when Simone Biles is happy? She's *always* doing cartwheels.

A 23-year-old British man broke a world record by stacking five M&M’s on top of each other. Not to be outdone, President Biden added a trillion dollars to his infrastructure plan for sustainable M&M stacking.
In Tennessee, two people were arrested for reportedly shooting up a Burger King after a dispute over a chicken sandwich. Apparently for them, "Have It Your Way" included wearing handcuffs.

A Florida company is selling tickets to ascend 20 miles above the Earth on board a luxury space balloon. The company says it's bringing to space travel the most cutting-edge scientific advances of 1873.

Today the Supreme Court ruled that a high school violated the free speech rights of a student cheerleader. Writing the majority opinion, Justice Breyer spelled it out a letter at a time, asked the school what it spelled, then gave the school an F and a U.
Cigarette company Philip Morris is moving its corporate headquarters from New York to Connecticut. But the headquarters will have to move outside to Rhode Island whenever it takes a smoke break.
Now on the New York Times bestsellers list, a new children's book written by the Duchess of Sussex, Meghan Markle. She doesn't enjoy writing. She just thought that royalty should get some royalties.
President Biden has removed a 25% tariff on imported Scotch whiskey. He explained that he did it because drinking more whiskey will help people forget he's raising their taxes.
In recent photographs, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un seems to have lost a lot of weight. But insiders say he's not happy about it. Apparently 30 of his pounds defected to South Korea.
A Nebraska man set a new world record by making 60 skydiving jumps in 24 hours while naked. He also set a new world record for most seagulls lodged in a human rectum.

Today President Biden gave Vladimir Putin a list of 16 critical infrastructure entities that are "off limits" to Russian cyberattacks. Putin thanked Biden by teaching him the Russian word for "to-do list."
A new study suggests that Covid-19 was in the U.S. by Christmas 2019. Health officials say the virus may have arrived right after Santa dropped off some presents at the Wuhan Institute of Virology.
It's Flag Day 2021. To celebrate, CNN analyst Jeffrey Toobin raised the Red, White, and Blue as he lowered his tighty-whities.

Reports say that production of the upcoming NBC series "Ultimate Slip 'N Slide" was halted after an outbreak of "explosive diarrhea" on the set. But why? Isn't a show called "Ultimate Slip 'N Slide" the perfect place for explosive diarrhea?

The FDA told Johnson & Johnson to throw away about 60 million doses of its Covid-19 vaccine that were produced at a plant in Baltimore. When asked for comment, the vaccine doses said they're just happy to be leaving Baltimore.
Today McDonald's said that hackers had accessed some customer personal data. No word on what the customer personal data was but chances are it wasn't number of pounds lost.
In May the state of Maine set another record for monthly sales of marijuana. Experts say that part of the reason is a popular new product, the L. L. Bean flannel bong.
Next month Jeff Bezos, the CEO of Amazon, will fly into space in a rocket. When he takes off, he'll email you a confirmation and an estimated landing date.

According to the Financial Times, China plans to operate at least 59 laboratories like the Wuhan Institute of Virology. Officials in China explained that for every product, they always want to be number one in exports.
Later this month, Congress is getting a report about "unidentified aerial phenomena." You know what airline pilots call an "unidentified aerial phenomenon?" A JetBlue flight that's on time.
Yesterday prominent defense attorney F. Lee Bailey passed away. But the good news is, today he filed an appeal.
This week China reported the world's first human case of H10N3 bird flu. They also proudly shared the news that the Wuhan Institute of Virology had just installed state-of-the-art screen doors.
Today the FDA said to avoid eating cicadas if you're allergic to seafood. Was that really necessary? Was anybody really looking for a reason not to eat cicadas?
Now in theaters, the sequel to the movie "A Quiet Place." It's about the annual Memorial Day barbecue with Bill and Melinda Gates.

According to the CDC, half of the U.S. population has received at least one dose of a coronavirus vaccine. And the other half of the U.S. population has received at least one middle finger from someone telling them to get vaccinated.

After serving almost three years in a state prison, actor Bill Cosby was just denied parole. Or as his agent put it, "Due to popular demand, Mr. Cosby's engagement at an exclusive 4,000-seat venue in Pennsylvania was just extended for another year."

An Ohio woman is the first winner of the state’s one million dollar vaccine lottery. Here's how it works: First she'll get half a million dollars, then 21 days later she'll get the second half a million, plus some soreness and swelling.

Scientists now think that Covid-19 may have escaped from a lab in Wuhan, China. As evidence, they point to a cell in the lab where there's a blanket almost covering a dummy coronavirus head made of papier-mache and hair clippings.
North Korea’s leader Kim Jong Un recently banned mullets and other "non-socialist" haircuts. CIA analysts say that based on his own haircut, he's also banned mirrors.
Over the weekend, an armed robber in the Times Square M&M Store stole three pairs of M&M socks. Police suspect a recently paroled serial killer named Rocco Candyankles.

A letter handwritten by Albert Einstein sold for $1.2 million because it contains his most famous equation, E equals MC squared. It also contains his second-most famous equation, A Moment on the Lips Equals a Lifetime on the Hips.

To encourage people to get Covid-19 vaccinations, the dating app OkCupid has some new features. If you haven't decided to get vaccinated yet, there's a feature called OkCovid. And if you've decided to never get vaccinated there's OkStupid.
The northeastern U.S. is being swarmed by billions of cicadas. There are billions of insects, or as New York City real estate agents say, the apartment is pet-friendly.
Amazon is in talks to buy Hollywood studio MGM, home of the James Bond movies. In fact, Amazon is already planning to remake one of them and call it "From Russia with Free Shipping."

California education officials are working on a new math curriculum that says it's not important to get the right answer. The officials hope that the new math curriculum will also be adopted by the other 43-and-a-half states.

California won't lift its mask requirement for another month. That doesn't seem fair. To get ready for not wearing a mask, celebrities need at least two months to catch up on their lip plumping, laugh line fillers, and collagen injections.

Today Kentucky Derby winner Medina Spirit will be racing in the Preakness. I don't want to say he's taking performance-enhancing drugs, but he's so fast that the race hasn't started yet and he's already won.

He's okay, but a Maryland driver set his car on fire when his cigarette lit a handful of hand sanitizer. The man said he learned his lesson, and from now on he'll only smoke while he's wearing a cloth face mask.
A fight between two women at an Ohio Walmart ended with one woman being hit in the face with ten pounds of meat. Something, something, Kim Kardashian's honeymoon.
The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have signed a partnership agreement with Procter & Gamble, the maker of Charmin. Insiders say their first project will be a new bathroom tissue called Royal Flush.
Mattel is collecting old Barbie dolls to recycle the materials. Insiders say the idea came from Barbie's boyfriend, Ken, after he met a cocktail waitress.

Experts say the demand for Covid vaccines is falling steeply in the United States. It's pretty dramatic. In fact, the demand for Covid vaccines is falling even faster than the demand for Peloton treadmills.
And here's the forecast for tonight: seasonal temperatures and partly cloudy skies, with a chance of a shower of flaming Chinese rocket debris.
This weekend, a 20-ton piece of a Chinese rocket will crash down somewhere on Earth. That's weird. What are the odds that an unpredictable, out-of-control import from China could be really dangerous?
In October, "The Phantom of the Opera" is returning to Broadway. But things will be reversed because of Covid: If the audience takes off their masks, it's the Phantom who'll scream.
It's Cinco de Mayo 2021. People are celebrating with Mexican food and margaritas. Pfizer is even serving vaccine syringes with salt around the rim.
Today is May the Fourth, Star Wars Day, when Stars Wars fans dress in costumes and duel with lightsabers. It's a date that's very important to some people who have never been on one.
Yesterday Elon Musk’s Dragon capsule safely splashed down in the Gulf of Mexico. Coincidentally, also splashing down in the Gulf of Mexico was one of Elon Musk's Teslas on Autopilot.
President Biden is building support for his $4 trillion spending plan. For example, he's telling Americans that he'll charge it to a credit card and share the 4 trillion reward miles.
Yesterday Queen Elizabeth gave an award for sales growth to a sex toy company in the U.K. Their bestsellers include toys called Big Ben, the Tower of London, and a variety pack they call Bonehenge.
Last night in his speech to Congress, President Biden proposed $1.8 trillion dollars in new spending. He also announced a new plan to pay for it. He calls it Operation Pickpocket Jeff Bezos.
It was closed for the pandemic, but this week the Roman Colosseum reopened to the public full-time. It's the perfect place for visitors to fight to the death about whether to wear a mask.
This week the FDA might ban the sale of menthol cigarettes in the U.S. That's bad news for smokers who rely on their cigarettes to give them a minty-fresh breath.
Last night's Academy Awards show had the lowest ratings ever. The ratings were so disappointing that the producers of "Nomadland" are doing a sequel called "No-audience-land."
In New Hampshire, a couple detonated 80 pounds of explosives for a gender reveal party. The expectant mother said the explosion was so powerful that it changed the gender from boy to girl.
This week a Virginia kindergarten teacher was arrested at school after police found cocaine in her desk. Students became suspicious when she claimed she was finger-painting with her nose.
It's Earth Day 2021, and President Biden is taking deforestation very seriously. This morning he looked in the mirror and made a solemn pledge to plant 100 new hair plugs.
Today the Manhattan District Attorney said that Manhattan will no longer prosecute prostitution. Finally, somebody's doing something to bring people back to Times Square.
The MyPillow company is suing Dominion Voting Systems for $1.6 billion. The good news is, MyPillow's CEO says it's Guaranteed To Be The Most Comfortable Lawsuit They’ll Ever Have.
Today NASA’s helicopter, Ingenuity, flew on Mars. Scientists say it's an important next step in human beings voyaging to another world and joining the Mile High Club.
Thanks for the kind words, Joy!
Today President Biden played golf for the first time as president. It was weird. Before he was president he hit the ball up the middle but now everything goes to the left.
Today Raul Castro announced that he's resigning as head of Cuba’s Communist Party. But he's not retiring. He said he's always wanted to open up a little red and breakfast.
This week Disney announced that its theme park employees will have a more flexible dress code. And it's about time. Finally, animation fans can go Donald Duck-style: no pants.
Yesterday Japan said it will dump radioactive water from the crippled Fukushima nuclear power plant into the Pacific Ocean. Which answers the question, "Will there be another 'Godzilla' sequel?"
In England over the weekend, the world's largest rabbit was stolen from his home. Police are searching for the thief and also for the driver of the getaway rabbit.

After recent biting incidents, the Bidens' dog Major will get professional help adjusting to the White House. And after recent insulting diatribes, Donald Trump will get professional help adjusting to not being in the White House.
In Florida, the Pfizer vaccine is now authorized for persons age 16 and up. But health officials caution that the vaccine won't protect 16-year-olds in an enclosed space with Matt Gaetz.
Today in New York City, Coney Island’s amusement parks reopened. There are six new attractions this year, including a scary ride for New Yorkers--the Tunnel of Cuomo.

A US Army captain set a world record by running a mile in 10 minutes, 23 seconds, in a bomb disposal suit. Also running really fast was everybody who noticed somebody running away in a bomb disposal suit.
Today the CDC said that the UK variant has become the most dominant Covid strain in the US. They said they're surprised the UK variant has spread so fast because every afternoon it stops for tea.
North Korea announced that it won't participate in the Tokyo Olympics. Which is a shame because North Korean gymnasts were favored to win the gold in rhythmic defecting.
Today Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a law allowing him to run for president two more times. The law also extended absentee voting: whoever votes against Putin goes mysteriously absent.
Tomorrow is Easter, so here comes Peter Cottontail, hoppin' down the bunny trail. But don't worry. Next year, thanks to President Biden's infrastructure bill, it'll be the bunny expressway.
It's almost Easter, and for a lot of people that means Marshmallow Peeps. There are marshmallow bunnies, marshmallow chicks, and new this year for Covid--marshmallow bats.
Now in theaters, the movie “Godzilla vs. Kong.” It's a little different because of Covid. Godzilla and King Kong have a huge battle because Kong refuses to wear a face mask.
One of President Biden's dogs dropped a pile of poop in a White House hallway. In the dog's defense, the new First Family in the White House always gets to redecorate.
Two cast members of “The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City” were arrested for fraud. Allegedly they scammed hundreds of people into thinking the show would be entertaining.
The crisis continues. A thousand yesterday, two thousand today, all with harrowing stories to tell. Not migrants from Mexico...women accusing Governor Cuomo.
This week California will start giving the Covid vaccine to anyone age 50 and over. In Los Angeles it'll be the two-shot version: the first shot is vaccine, the second is Botox.
The U.S. Army plans to allow female soldiers to wear their hair in a ponytail. Still against regulations, though: the camouflaged man bun.
WWII codebreaker and computer scientist Alan Turing is on the new 50 pound British note. But this is weird...you can only exchange it for 1 pound notes and 0 pound notes.
A huge ship got stuck sideways in the Suez Canal and stopped all traffic from getting through. And in the US, Republican leaders asked if it could get stuck sideways across the US-Mexico border.
Krispy Kreme will give you a free glazed doughnut every day this year if you've received a Covid-19 vaccination. It's all part of their new Covid promotion: "Fattening the Curve."
The CDC now says that children wearing masks can safely attend school if they stay 3 feet apart. But they also say that female teachers should continue to stay 6 feet away from Governor Cuomo.
The Biden administration is sending 2.5 million doses of Covid vaccine to Mexico. And 2.5 million Mexicans are like, "Don't bother. We'll get vaccinated when we get to the U.S."
Today an Australian police official suggested developing a phone app that would document sexual consent. He said it would be like the website "Go Fund Me" but with two different consonants.
It's St. Patrick's Day, and this year a lot of celebrations are taking place online. The parties don't last long, though, because people keep shorting out their laptops with green vomit.

Today Israeli archaeologists announced the discovery of more Dead Sea Scrolls. But the Amazon website immediately refused to carry the scrolls because of their disparaging portrayals of Mesopotamians and Hittites.

Tonight everybody changes their clocks for Daylight Saving Time, including NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo. But he gets confused when he resets the minute hand and the hour hand. He's always putting his hands in the wrong place.
Over the weekend, the inventor of the audio tape cassette died. Funeral services will be given to friends as a mixtape.
Today President Biden signed the $2 trillion Covid stimulus bill. And he was so happy with the bill that he tacked on a $500 billion tip.

One of President Biden's dogs had a "biting incident." Insiders say it's the worst behavior by a dog in the White House since NY Governor Andrew Cuomo humped Melania Trump's leg.

According to a report in the UK, Meghan Markle has been accused of bullying aides at Buckingham Palace. You know what that means...NY Governor Andrew Cuomo is qualified to be the Duchess of Sussex.
SpaceX's Starship rocket landed upright in Texas but then exploded. Because it was in Texas, the blast was so powerful it blew everybody's Covid mask back on.

President Biden said states that lift Covid restrictions are guilty of "Neanderthal thinking." He explained that it's like when he was a kid watching his neighbors trying to eat a mastodon before they discovered fire.

Over the weekend, the FDA approved Johnson & Johnson's single-dose vaccine. New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said he's so excited about the new vaccine that he could kiss it on the lips.
This week U.S. fighter jets dropped seven 500-pound bombs on Iranian-backed militias in Syria. Then, to make sure they got the message, a United Airlines plane dropped an engine on them.
New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo has been accused of sexual harassment and bullying. The good news is, now he can check off two boxes on Trump's Mar-a-Lago membership application.
A former adviser to New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said that he created a culture of sexual harassment and bullying. In his defense, Gov. Cuomo said that he's always been a big supporter of culture.
Today President Biden announced his three nominees to join the board of the U.S. Postal Service. Unfortunately they weren't able to join the board because nobody was there to sign for them.
Hillary Clinton is co-writing a mystery novel. She loves mysteries and this one sounds amazing. It's called, "How the Hell Did Trump Beat Me?"
Dominion Voting Systems is suing the CEO of MyPillow for $1.3 billion. The lawsuit was originally for $1 billion, but it got bigger when the MyPillow Guy patted it and fluffed it up.
Almost 7,000 Toro snow blowers are being recalled because they pose an amputation hazard. On the plus side, New York Governor Andrew Cuomo is giving all the snow blowers free to local nursing homes.
New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo is taking a lot of criticism about that nursing home scandal. But this should make him feel better. Ted Cruz just invited him over for a pitcher of margaritas.
The winter weather emergency in Texas continues. Frigid temperatures, burst pipes, no electricity. In fact, things have gotten so bad that Ted Cruz is flying back to Cancun.
Scientists in Siberia have discovered million-year-old woolly mammoth DNA. The scientists were thrilled, and so was a woolly mammoth when Maury Povich told him, "You are NOT the father!"
Vice President Kamala Harris is talking to foreign leaders on the phone without President Biden. As a result, insiders say that Biden may have FOMO--Fear Of Missing Obama.
The low temperature in New York today was 35 degrees. Or as Governor Cuomo put it, "The low temperature in New York today was a balmy 74 degrees."
Tomorrow is Valentine's Day. You know the holiday is a little different this year because Cupid is shooting people with arrows dipped in Moderna vaccine.

Jeep aired a commercial featuring Bruce Springsteen after he was charged with driving while intoxicated. When asked for comment, Jeep officials pleaded guilty to approving a commercial while intoxicated.
The publisher of Hustler magazine, Larry Flynt, has passed away. For his funeral, in lieu of flowers, Mr. Flynt has requested nude selfies.

Hundreds of articles of clothing that belonged to "Jeopardy" host Alex Trebek are being donated to charity. The charity says if you're the first one to grab a suit, you can buy it for $200, $400, $600, $800, or $1000.
So now there's a new variant. People are concerned. Is it like the original? How serious is it? Yes, I'm talking about Trump's second impeachment trial.

Today Johnson & Johnson applied for authorization of its single-shot Covid-19 vaccine. To encourage Americans to get the shots, they're putting the vaccine in little single-shot glasses of Jello.

Today the White House press secretary said that the Space Force has the full support of the Biden administration. She then announced the Space Force's next mission--launching Marjorie Taylor Greene to the moon.
Now anybody can buy a pair of those mittens Bernie Sanders wore at the inauguration. Bernie says they're great for when you don't want people to see you're giving Republicans the finger.
O. J. Simpson just got a vaccination against the coronavirus. In a related story, the coronavirus just got an order of protection against O. J. Simpson.
In the past nine days, President Biden has signed forty executive orders. Forty signed orders. Which explains why his latest order expands Obamacare to cover writer's cramp.

Two California residents filed a lawsuit claiming that there is no tuna in Subway's tuna sandwiches. If they win, they’ll get $10 million plus, for an extra $2.60, a Diet Coke and a bag of potato chips.
Kraft is selling pink, sweet-tasting, "candy" macaroni and cheese for Valentine's Day. Just when you thought they couldn't make macaroni and cheese any more romantic.
The Department of Justice has identified 400 suspects in connection with the attack on the U.S. Capitol. The DOJ said they found the suspects by going on Tinder and swiping far right.
Godiva is closing all of its U.S. chocolate stores. Company officials say the problem was Covid-19 took a bite out of their revenue and they never knew what they were gonna get.
Pfizer announced a way to increase the number of doses you can get from each vial of their Covid-19 vaccine. It’s a new product they developed with Betty Crocker called Vaccine Helper.
Amazon offered to help President Biden distribute coronavirus vaccines. To be fair, Amazon Prime offered Donald Trump complimentary ad-free streaming of his impeachment trial.
President Biden got right to work today. He's promising 100 million in his first 100 days. 100 million in his first 100 days. Not Covid vaccinations...overturned Trump policies.

The PGA voted not to hold the PGA Championship at President Trump's golf club in New Jersey. To make up for the lost revenue, Trump wants to host another high-profile event at the club--his impeachment trial.
Yesterday Twitter suspended the account of President Trump. He responded by launching his own version of Snapchat--Crapchat.

The FDA said there should be 28 days between the first and second dose of the Moderna vaccine. They also said that for maximum effectiveness, there should be 12 months between the first and second impeachment of President Trump.

Some good news: Today it was announced that Animal Planet's Puppy Bowl will take place next month as planned. Even better, the winner doesn't have to be certified by Mike Pence.

Residents of a New York City neighborhood are being randomly attacked by squirrels. Animal control officials say it's the weirdest behavior they've seen in the city since that New Year's Eve performance by Cyndi Lauper.

A lot of people are making New Year's resolutions to stop smoking, stop drinking, and lose weight. But they know they'll never have to do it because all those resolutions will be blocked by Mitch McConnell.
A house for sale in Vermont includes seven jail cells. But it won't be on the market for long. Bernie Sanders wants to buy it for the Trump family.

Dr. Anthony Fauci says not enough Americans are getting the Covid vaccine shots. To help speed things up, two days from now, in Times Square, Ryan Seacrest will be hosting "Doc Fauci's New Year's Rockin' and Inoculatin' Eve."

The U.S. Postal Service said it's dealing with "unprecedented" mail volume. Apparently millions of letters are stacked up, and that's just from people asking for pardons from President Trump.

President Trump is still handing out some pretty controversial pardons. But this one seems okay. For Christmas, he just pardoned the Grinch.
Kilauea volcano in Hawaii keeps gushing molten lava and huge amounts of sulfur dioxide. The volcano is still pretty dangerous, but this is weird: President Trump pardoned it.

Antarctica recorded its first Covid-19 case after 36 people tested positive on a research base. And up at the North Pole, Santa confirmed the first known case of Covid-19 transmission from reindeer to elf.
British officials say a new mutation of the coronavirus could be 70 percent more infectious. 70 percent more infectious...that's nothing to sneeze at.

A big crowd watched two women fighting over a video game console at a Walmart in North Carolina. Two women in a Walmart fighting over a video game console...or as they call it in North Carolina, the Annual Christmas Pageant.

An Alabama sheriff's office says it's busted an illegal winery that was operating at a sewage plant. They said the sewage plant was making a red wine, a white wine, and a wine that's neither of those colors.
Tom Cruise shouted and cursed at crew members on a movie set who weren't social distancing. Apparently his temper is short, too.
The rollout of the Covid-19 vaccine is going pretty smoothly. In fact, Pfizer is so happy, for the holidays, they're also offering a complimentary injection of egg nog.

President Trump still refuses to concede to Joe Biden. But Trump is softening his position a little. Now when he says "Build that wall," he only means around the White House.

Today is National Cookie Day. On a sad note, the Keebler Elves threw a crowded, maskless party in their tree and gave the Covid to that old Pepperidge Farm guy.

Today that Chinese spacecraft on the moon collected some lunar samples to take back to Earth. NASA scientists are excited because they love Chinese takeout.
Joe Biden injured his foot and may have to wear a walking boot for a few weeks. He says the good news is that the boot will make it harder for him to put his foot in his mouth.

Cambridge University says that two notebooks written by Charles Darwin with his ideas about evolution have been stolen. Witnesses described a suspect who started walking on all fours, then walked in a crouch, and finally walked upright.
It's the day after Thanksgiving and a lot of people are trying to finish off their Thanksgiving leftovers. You know what they call Thanksgiving leftovers in the White House? The Trumps.

Tomorrow is the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. Each balloon will have two dozen specially-trained handlers who will make sure it doesn't drift off course. You know, the way they do for Joe Biden.

A British magician broke a Guinness World Record by performing twenty magic tricks under water in just three minutes. He also broke the World Record for smallest scuba tank on a rabbit.
Because of the coronavirus, the CDC is pleading with Americans not to travel for Thanksgiving. And President Trump is like, "See? Even the CDC says I should stay in the White House."

The Arecibo radio telescope in Puerto Rico is so damaged that it'll have to be demolished. Astronomers say it became dangerously overloaded while searching for signs of intelligent life in President Trump's Twitter feed.

Magician David Copperfield is suspending his Las Vegas stage show after a crew member tested positive for Covid-19. Copperfield also said he's retiring his newest illusion--sawing a horseshoe bat in half.

Boxer Mike Tyson says he used a prosthetic penis filled with baby urine to pass drug tests. He said he bought the urine on a website called peeBay.

According to her lawyer, singer Britney Spears won't perform again as long as her father controls her career. She also won't perform again as long as her father refuses to fix the tape machine she lip syncs to.
Today Pizza Hut and Beyond Meat debuted a plant-based sausage pizza. President Trump was so excited that he had 200 unwanted plant-based sausage pizzas delivered to Joe Biden's house.
Great news: Today Pfizer announced that its coronavirus vaccine is 90% effective. But President Trump isn't impressed. He says that his campaign was also 90% effective.
According to projections, Joe Biden has won the 2020 presidential election. But there's some good news for President Trump. He was just declared the winner in the race for Most Flagged Tweets.
BALLOT COUNTING UPDATE: Minutes ago there was a problem in Pennsylvania. A ballot counter got that song "867-5309" stuck in his head and had to start all over.
BREAKING: The CDC just issued a health alert about alarming new spikes in Georgia, Michigan, and Pennsylvania. Not Covid-19 infections...ballot counter paper cuts.
The NBA is talking about starting their next season in December. So all the teams are getting ready to play during the coronavirus. Like, the New York Knicks have a plan for drive-thru sucking.
Election Day isn't until tomorrow but the total is already over 97 million. 97 million! I'm not talking about the number of people who have voted. I'm talking about the number of lawyers on standby.

This year Halloween trick-or-treating is a little different with the coronavirus. For example, Mars Candy just announced the 3 Musketeers bar is down to 2 Musketeers because D’Artagnan is in quarantine.

In next week's election, Oregon could become the first US state to decriminalize small amounts of heroin, cocaine, and LSD. That's terrible. That'll be too late for tomorrow's Halloween trick-or-treating.

At least two counties in Pennsylvania won't begin counting mail-in ballots until after Election Day. That's why Pennsylvania is changing its nickname from the Keystone State to the Keep 'Em Waitin' State.
Over the weekend a New York City man was swarmed by rats after he fell more than a dozen feet into a sinkhole when the pavement caved in. Finally, New York City is getting back to normal.
According to NPR, Democratic candidates are way ahead of Republicans when it comes to fundraising this year. In fact, the Democrats have so much money, Hunter Biden bought a new laptop.
Yesterday President Trump had a Halloween celebration on the South Lawn for hundreds of kids in costumes. Observers say it was the weirdest sight: people at the White House wearing masks?!
Because of the coronavirus, this year the Westminster dog show is being moved out of Madison Square Garden. And to protect them when they socialize, all the dogs will wear masks on their butts.
Bug hunters in Washington state found the first ever Asian giant "murder hornets" nest in the U.S. They said the nest used to have bees living in it. It was an Air-bee-n-bee.

Because of the coronavirus, Santa Claus won't be greeting kids at Macy's in New York City this year. Instead, Dr. Anthony Fauci will be there, testing some kids, checking them twice, gonna find out who's Infected and Nice.
Dutch scientists have discovered what could possibly be a new organ in the human body. The scientists say they discovered the organ when they noticed Jeffrey Toobin rubbing it.

The Commission on Presidential Debates is going to turn off the candidates' microphones during parts of the final debate. And as a public service, they'll also turn off the video during any Zoom calls with Jeffrey Toobin.
Some of the old movies that are streaming on Disney Plus will start with a disclaimer that the movies include racist stereotypes. Oh, so that's what the "Plus" stands for.
Somebody dumped a big pile of eels in a park in Brooklyn. A local official couldn't identify the eels' species, but because they're in Brooklyn, said they had to be Democrats.
The Hormel company is offering a bacon-scented face mask to help protect against Covid-19. Is that a good idea? If it smells like bacon, instead of wearing it, maybe Trump will eat it.
This week a 2,350-pound pumpkin won a pumpkin-growing contest in California. Spectators were amazed. It's orange, it weighs a ton, and nobody made a joke about President Trump.
Tonight was the season premiere of "The Amazing Race." That’s what Republicans call voting in a new Supreme Court justice before Election Day.
An Arizona couple found what looked like part of an airliner that had fallen in their back yard. A part fell off an airliner. Wow, that would be a big problem if airlines had any passengers.
Punk rocker Johnny Rotten is supporting President Trump for the 2020 election. That actually makes sense. The Sex Pistol is voting for the candidate who's against gun control.
The Commission on Presidential Debates canceled the second debate. So voters won't get a chance to find out where the candidates stand on the important issues...pretty much like the first debate.
Facebook removed an ad for onions for being "overtly sexual." Then they restored the ad and fired an ad censor for being "overtly lonely."
Hurricane Delta is heading for the US with winds forecast at over 130 mph. Meteorologists say the winds are so strong they could blow a fly off Mike Pence's head.
Plexiglass barriers were installed for the vice-presidential debate tonight. President Trump is furious about the barriers. He says he's going to make the coronavirus pay for them.
Today pet retailer Petco announced that it will no longer sell electronic "shock" collars. But they did agree to set one aside for President Trump at the next debate.

His doctor said that President Trump can return to the White House even though he's not "entirely out of the woods yet." Apparently the problem is, Trump is so fat, he can't squeeze between the trees.
President Trump is still in the hospital for Covid-19. Doctors say the good news is the virus isn't making any progress because Trump's immune system keeps interrupting it.
President Trump is now showing symptoms of Covid-19. The good news is, experts say he won't lose his sense of taste because he's always been tasteless.
Here's a reminder from the CDC: The main symptoms are fever, headache, and nausea. If you're experiencing any of those symptoms, you may have watched the first Presidential Debate.

A British zoo had to separate five foul-mouthed parrots who were encouraging each other to swear. Zoo visitors were shocked and disgusted. They said it was like watching last night's Presidential Debate.
An asteroid is expected to come close to Earth on the day before Election Day. Because it will be moving so fast right before Election Day, NASA named it Asteroid Amy Coney Barrett Nomination.

Adidas is selling furry sneakers inspired by the "Star Wars" character Chewbacca. If you buy them you can celebrate 40 years since the debut of "The Empire Strikes Back" and also 40 years since your last date.

Today a city in Texas issued a disaster declaration when it found drinking water containing a brain-eating amoeba. It's pretty serious. Officials said the effects of the brain-eating amoeba are as bad as Twitter.
A Tennessee woman broke a Guinness World Record by hugging a tree for over 10 hours. Hugging a tree, or as they call that in Tennessee, a "Tinder date."
As if 2020 hasn't been chaotic enough, now people are talking about whether there's going to be a second wave this fall. Not coronavirus cases...Trump impeachment charges.

Write your own joke: Firefighters in England put out a fire that started in a 22-ton pile of chicken manure. A 22-ton pile of chicken manure, or as we call it here in the U.S., the [Choose one: Democratic or Republican] Party platform.
Disney's Animal Kingdom has some great news: three white rhinos at the park are pregnant. Disney officials made the announcement two weeks after the night that Goofy got drunk.
Starting tomorrow you can register to vote at Footlocker shoe stores. Then after you get your new voter registration they suggest you walk around the store with it a little to see how it feels.
A new poll says that only 22% of Americans believe that this year’s presidential election will be “free and fair.” We don't know yet what the other 78% believe because they mailed in their opinions.
An Alaska dentist was found guilty of 46 felony and misdemeanor counts and sentenced to 12 years in prison. So now he's the one who's going to be told to "Open wide."
The head of Russia's space agency has claimed Venus as a "Russian planet." Which makes sense because German scientists said the poison in the Venusian atmosphere came from Vladimir Putin.
All the walls and ceilings of a condo for sale in Florida are completely covered in Budweiser beer cans. The condo has two bedrooms, a patio, and six urinals.

Scientific American magazine endorsed Joe Biden, the first time they've endorsed a presidential candidate in their 175-year history. Biden said he was thrilled, especially because he's been a loyal subscriber since the first issue.
This year the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade is making some changes for Covid-19. To keep everybody safe, they're replacing the Snoopy balloon with a helium-filled Dr. Anthony Fauci.
Today police fired tear gas in Paris again. The good news is, because of French hygiene, Parisians are used to their eyes watering.

Write your own joke: This week in Albuquerque, strong winds blew a portable toilet down a busy street. Onlookers were shocked. They thought the most crap-filled thing on the road was the [Choose one: Trump or Biden] campaign bus.

Today Microsoft said that Russian, Chinese, and Iranian hackers have all tried to hack the 2020 US presidential election. To make matters worse, that doesn't even include all their mail-in, absentee hacks.
Today an Oscar Mayer Wienermobile driver proposed to his girlfriend in front of the Wienermobile. He didn't actually say anything. He just pointed to the Wienermobile and then to his pants.
Some good news: the violence we saw in New York City over the weekend has died down. Yes, as of today, no one else has taken a tennis ball in the throat from Novak Djokovic.

According to firefighters, one of those terrible wildfires in California this weekend was caused by a pyrotechnic device at a gender reveal photo shoot. It turns out it was also an IQ reveal photo shoot.

In Pakistan, the "world's loneliest elephant" is finally being transferred to a better zoo. Officials say he was the world's loneliest elephant because he told the other elephants he was casting an absentee ballot for Trump.
Carole Baskin, from the Netflix series “Tiger King,” is going to be on the show “Dancing With the Stars.” Producers say it's a better fit for her than their other show, "I Didn't Kill My Husband."

House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is taking some heat for getting her hair styled inside a salon in spite of Covid-19 restrictions. Of course, President Trump is thrilled. Finally people are obsessing about a politician's hair and it's not his.
Airline pilots landing at LAX reported seeing a man in a jetpack flying at 3,000 feet. The man explained later that he was practicing for a new sport: Extreme Mile-High Club.
A Florida man caught a record-setting catfish that weighed almost 70 pounds. Because it was Florida, the catfish was caught while it was running naked out of a meth lab.
An Ohio man built in his backyard a squirrel bar that offers seven kinds of nuts. The man was described as seven kinds of nuts.
This week, three farmers in Scotland paid almost half a million dollars for a sheep. The sheep was described as well-proportioned, silky-haired, and very nervous.

Police officers in France were criticized for telling topless women on the beach to cover up. Apparently the French police are the only thing protecting society from bare breasts. They're the Thin Boob Line.
An asteroid is going to fly extremely close to Earth on the day before Election Day. But President Trump says don't worry...because it's a mail-in asteroid it's probably fake.
Today a Swiss man performed the first jump and free fall from a solar-powered aircraft. He said he decided to perform the jump when the sun went behind a cloud.
Sadly, the number of worldwide deaths has passed 800,000. Not victims of the coronavirus...critics of Vladimir Putin.
So far at least three dozen states have reported coronavirus cases on college campuses. The good news is, Lori Loughlin made sure that her daughters will never get the coronavirus at USC.
Syracuse University suspended 23 students for breaking rules against large gatherings during the pandemic. In their defense, the students were playing that new drinking game--Hydroxychloroquine Pong.
Yesterday in Manhattan, some people lifted a car off a woman who was pinned under it. Of course, because it was Manhattan, they only moved the car so they could take the parking space.
Over the weekend, the temperature in Death Valley, California, was 130 degrees. But meteorologists say that in California 130 degrees seems like only 120 degrees because of Botox.
Presumptive Democratic vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris chose "Pioneer" as her Secret Service code name. Then she spent six hours teaching people it's not pronounced "Pie-OH-neer."

In Philadelphia, the Philly Naked Bike Ride was cancelled because of the coronavirus. Apparently the naked bike riders discovered that even Purell wasn't strong enough to disinfect their bicycle seats.
Archaeologists in South Africa have discovered evidence of a 200,000-year-old grass bed. Apparently it was in the last room available at the Johannesburg Econo Lodge.

Next week the movie theater chain AMC will reopen more than 100 U.S. theaters. But they're taking precautions for the coronavirus. To make sure the theaters get filled to less than 10% of capacity, they're only showing Adam Sandler movies.
A popular Star Wars ride at Disney World was temporarily shut down after it was hit by lightning. Meteorologists say it would have hit the ride six hours later but it had a Fastpass.

Today Facebook said that it removed 7 million posts for sharing false information about the coronavirus. But don't worry...if you wanted to read them, they were all retweeted yesterday by President Trump.
Because its computer systems were hacked, Capital One has agreed to pay an $80 million fine. So if you want to know what's in their wallet, it's not $80 million.
Now underway in South Dakota, the legendary Sturgis Motorcycle Rally. Everybody's getting into the spirit. Even the coronaviruses are popping wheelies.
Students in one Illinois district are forbidden from wearing pajamas while taking online classes. Officials say that wearing pajamas makes it harder for the students to focus on pretending to learn.

A new report says that the food packaging used at McDonald's and Burger King may contain toxic chemicals. The good news is, their customers are immune because the chemicals can't get through their clogged arteries.
Cheetos is coming out with Cheetos-flavored mac and cheese. Cheetos Mac ‘n Cheese will come in three flavors: Bold & Cheesy, Flamin’ Hot, and I Don't Care What I Put in My Body.

The Indianapolis Motor Speedway won't allow fans at the Indianapolis 500 this year because of Covid-19. They're taking it pretty seriously. To show the race is over, they'll wave a checkered face mask.
On the FDA's list of over 100 dangerous hand sanitizers is Hello Kitty Hand Sanitizer. According to the FDA, the toxic methanol in it could make you say "Goodbye, Kitty."

President Trump said he plans to ban the social media platform TikTok from the United States. He said that anybody who wants to waste their time looking at weird little things online can just read his tweets.

Yesterday NASA launched a new rover to Mars, to prepare for humans to go there. Officials sped up the timetable when they realized how many people will want to relocate if President Trump is reelected.
A new study reveals the origin of many of the stones in England's prehistoric Stonehenge. According to scientists, the biggest stones came from Keith Richards's kidneys.
Today is National Lipstick Day. So put on your favorite, sexiest color lipstick, pucker up, and then describe to people what it looks like under your face mask.

The USDA is warning Americans not to plant suspicious seeds they may have received in the mail from China. U.S. officials suspect it's a subversive Communist plot to trick Americans into eating more vegetables.
Today Garmin, the GPS company, revealed that it was the victim of a cyber-attack. Officials said they lost some customer data but found it by driving two-tenths of a mile, then turning right.
Hurricane Hanna is heading straight for the coast of Texas. The National Weather Service wants it to miss, so they're renaming it Hurricane Fauci.

Today McDonald's announced that all customers in its U.S. restaurants must wear face masks. They say it’s a matter of public health because if your mouth is covered by a mask you can't eat their food.

Stone tools recently found in a cave suggest that humans were living in North America about 26,000 years ago. Archaeologists even believe that the cave with all the stone tools may have been a primitive store called Homo Sapiens Depot.

At the Opening Day game between the Yankees and the Nationals, Dr. Anthony Fauci is going to throw out the first pitch. Even more exciting, then President Trump is going to tell reporters that Fauci threw it wrong.
Today supermodel Bar Refaeli was convicted of evading taxes. In her defense, she didn't actually evade the taxes; she strutted up to the taxes, struck a pose, then sashayed away from the taxes.
White Castle is testing a burger-flipping robot named Flippy. And to handle customers who really love White Castle burgers, they have a robot named Forklift.
This weekend, the heat index in Washington DC is forecast to reach 100 degrees. It's not global warming; it's President Trump burning copies of his niece's new book.
A new study says that the moon is 85 million years younger than previous estimates. In fact, scientists say the moon is so young that Ghislaine Maxwell introduced it to Jeffrey Epstein.
Today somebody hacked many prominent Twitter accounts and used them to tweet about a cryptocurrency scam. Gee, I hope that doesn't damage Twitter's reputation for trustworthiness and credibility.
The new comet Neowise is on its way out of the Solar System. But it'll be visible again around the year 9000...so about the same time as President Trump's tax returns.
Ask a four-time Emmy winner anything about comedy or his advances in computational humor. #AI #NLProc
Activists in Washington DC are petitioning to decriminalize "magic" mushrooms and other natural psychedelics. They say they're tired of being arrested by three-headed unicorns.
Tropical Storm Fay is pounding the East Coast. The wind is so strong, it actually blew a statue of Christopher Columbus back onto its pedestal.
Some states are making less revenue from lottery tickets because of the coronavirus. Experts explain that instead of scratching off lottery tickets, residents are gambling by scratching their faces.
Hasbro is banning slurs and other offensive words from official Scrabble tournaments. In fact, now there's even a 50-point penalty if you put an F next to a U.
Mike Pompeo says the app TikTok is a security threat because it's connected to the Chinese government. He also warned about a new version of the dating app Ashley Madison: Ashley Mao Tse-tung.
Over the weekend, health officials reported a case of possible bubonic plague in Inner Mongolia. So crowds of people from Lake of the Ozarks immediately flew there to have a pool party.
Today Joey Chestnut won the Nathan's hot dog eating contest by eating 75 hot dogs and buns. He stopped celebrating when he realized there's still a nationwide toilet paper shortage.
Tomorrow is the Fourth of July. Even President Trump plans to celebrate. But instead of sparklers, he's going to wave around burning copies of John Bolton's book.
A new report says that in 2019, humans generated a record-breaking amount of electronic waste. Experts say most of the electronic waste was mobile phones, TV sets, and Trump tweets.
That pop culture phenomenon "Beavis and Butt-Head" is returning to television. You'll be able to see them on September 29 at the first presidential debate.
The FBI is warning about fraudulent Covid-19 antibody tests. Officials stress that real antibody tests do not involve the health worker asking you to "Pull my finger."
Cirque du Soleil plans to fire about 3,500 circus workers. The good news is, now all the clowns, contortionists, and manure shovelers can run for Congress.

In Michigan, 85 people tested positive for Covid-19 after they contracted the virus at a restaurant. It was a little annoying. 80 people wanted to contract it, but the virus made them wait until the other 5 people arrived.
Today the House voted to grant statehood to Washington DC. They also picked a Washington DC state bird. It has a blue left wing, a red right wing, and it just flies around in circles.
Today the governor of Texas announced that the reopening of Texas has been halted. That's why they're temporarily changing their tourism slogan to "Forget the Alamo."
So far this month, there have been over 13 thousand fireworks complaints in New York City. But it's not as bad as it seems. Officials say half of those bangs were actually gunfire.

The second presidential debate this fall is being moved to Florida. It's the perfect place. Trump is 74 and Biden is 77. If they get confused during the debate they can switch over to playing shuffleboard.
John Bolton's book officially comes out tomorrow. President Trump is so angry about it that he's buying a copy. He thinks if he buys the book, it'll go bankrupt.
People at the Trump rally in Tulsa tonight don't seem very concerned about the coronavirus. In fact, they have a special greeting for when they see each other twice. It's called the Second Wave.
President Trump wants to stop the release of John Bolton's new book next Tuesday. The president says it would put him in grave danger of actually reading a book.
A woman in California was attacked by a bear but fought it off with her laptop computer. She said the bear ran away terrified when she showed it President Trump's Twitter feed.

China removed the armadillo-like animal the pangolin from its approved list of traditional medicines. The move affects Coronavirus-Strength Pangolin, Non-Drowsy Pangolin, and Chewable Pangolin for Kids.
The Academy Awards have been postponed eight weeks because of the coronavirus. And to make air-kissing on the red carpet safer, celebrities will be plumping their lips with shots of Purell.
According to a new report, deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon set a record last month. Officials say the Brazilian deforestation was so extensive it was like bikini season at the Kardashians.

For her role in the college bribery scandal, the Hot Pockets heiress is going to prison. They'll keep her in there for 30 minutes if it's a conventional prison and 2 minutes if it's a microwave prison.
Today the Florida theme park SeaWorld Orlando reopened after being closed due to the coronavirus. New safety protocols include the mandatory use of protective masks on the dolphins' blowholes.
President Trump says he will not consider renaming military bases named for Confederate generals. But to show his support for the Marines, he does plan to change Parris Island to Paris Hilton Island.
Coffee-and-donut chain Dunkin' plans to hire up to 25,000 workers. More accurately, Dunkin' officials say they want 1,000 dozen assorted workers and 1,000 dozen Bavarian Kreme-Filled workers.

The governor of California said TV production can start up again with proper safety measures. So along with "The Masked Singer" you'll see the "The Masked Bachelor," "The Walking and Hand-Washing Dead," and "Last Man Standing Six Feet Away."
"The Fast and the Furious" actress Jordana Brewster and her husband have separated. Actually they separated, then crashed into each other, flipped over, and exploded into a huge fireball.
She's okay, but while actress Cate Blanchett was in quarantine she got a little head injury from a chainsaw accident. Wives, that's what happens when you let your husband cut your hair.
An Australian woman found a gold ring in a package of green beans. "I thought he'd never ask," said the woman, the future Mrs. Jolly Green Giant.
To protect against Covid-19, a new study recommends wearing face masks during sex. And before you go from second base to third base, they recommend a 14-day quarantine.

The seventh "Mission: Impossible" movie will start filming again in September. They're making some changes for the coronavirus. Tom Cruise's mission is to get the last roll of toilet paper in a Piggly Wiggly.
"Duck Dynasty" star Phil Robertson revealed that he has an adult daughter from a previous affair. He said the daughter is legally his because he got her during humping season.
Many cities are now allowing restaurants to reopen for outdoor dining. And in another sign of returning normalcy, New York City is once again featuring al fresco urination.

Write your own joke: 
The IRS is warning people not to accidentally throw away the stimulus payment they get in the mail. Government experts advise that if you want to throw away your money, donate it instead to the [Choose one: Biden or Trump] campaign.
Today the Boston Marathon was canceled. But if you want to see thousands of people running as fast as they can, just wait for all the residents fleeing Hong Kong.
Today the launch of the SpaceX rocket was postponed because of stormy weather. Joe Biden disagreed with the decision because he said the sky wasn't black.

Missouri health officials told the people at that crowded Ozarks pool party to self-quarantine for 14 days. Partiers responded by socially isolating the middle finger of one hand from their other fingers.
Over Memorial Day weekend, partiers crowded into poolside bars at Lake of the Ozarks in Missouri. It's not like they just ignored the coronavirus, though. They had a Wet Face Mask Contest.
As a result of too much debt and the coronavirus, Hertz filed for bankruptcy. Plus Hertz officials owe an extra billion dollars because they didn't return the company with a full tank of gas.

In Italy, Burger King introduced its new "social distancing Whopper," with extra onions to help keep people away. There's also a social distancing T-shirt that reads "Don't stand behind me. I just ate at Chipotle."
A New York City couple was caught having sex on an almost-empty subway platform. What a crazy thing to do!  Don't they know in the subway they could catch the coronavirus?
New York City will try killing coronavirus on the subways with ultraviolet light. The downside is, it attracts rats getting a head start on their summer tans.
The Ford Motor Company said President Trump should wear a coronavirus mask when he visits their factory this week. To help persuade him, Ford said he could take the mask out for a test cough.
Today President Trump said that he's taking the drug hydroxychloroquine, an unproven treatment for COVID-19. That's weird. Usually questionable stuff is coming out of his mouth instead of going in.
Justin Bieber says he wishes he had waited until he was married to have sex. He also says he wishes he had waited until he had talent to start singing.
A New York barber who continued to illicitly cut hair has tested positive for coronavirus. In his defense, between customers he disinfected himself inside a tall glass jar full of blue liquid.
Six Flags is opening a drive-thru safari tour in New Jersey, featuring over 1,000 exotic animals. They're also opening one in Wuhan, China, that's all-you-can-eat.
A 113-year-old woman in Spain beat the coronavirus. She says she doesn't have the coronavirus anymore. Either that or she can't remember where she put it.

A Pennsylvania gym reopened during the state's lockdown and received four citations. Actually the gym received a high-intensity set of two citations, then had a one-minute cool down, then received another set of two citations.
Today the White House began requiring all staffers in the West Wing to wear masks. The masks are to protect President Trump when he's talking and somebody accidentally coughs, sneezes, or laughs.
The European Space Agency says that to make concrete on the Moon, one useful ingredient could be human urine. They're calling the project "One giant leak for mankind."
Oregon’s World Naked Bike Ride was canceled because of the coronavirus. It's been replaced by the World Naked-Below-the-Waist Zoom Meeting.
Because she reopened during the coronavirus shutdown, a Dallas salon owner was sentenced to seven days in jail. She was also convicted of mani-pedi larceny.
Thanks for your kind words about my book, and congratulations on your new late-night show!
It's Cinco de Mayo 2020. To celebrate, President Trump asked Dr. Anthony Fauci about making protective face masks out of tortillas.
Asian Giant Hornets, known as "Murder Hornets," have entered the United States. So now when you hear "personal protective equipment," it includes a suit of armor.
North Korea's Kim Jong Un was reportedly seen in public for the first time in weeks. He was very careful about social distancing. Anybody within six feet was executed.
Singer Madonna revealed that she has coronavirus antibodies. She says she has no idea how she caught the coronavirus, and neither does her latest lover, a Chinese horseshoe bat.
Today Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden formally began the process of choosing a running mate. During the process, insiders expect him to be very hands-on.
Because of the coronavirus lockdown, a strip club in Oregon created a drive-thru strip club in their parking lot. What a shame that some people had to cheapen the whole strip club experience.
A pet dog in North Carolina is the first dog in the U.S. to test positive for the coronavirus. As a result, President Trump is now warning humans not to sniff each other's butts.
Rumors are still going around that Kim Jong Un might be very sick or even dead. Hey, you know how North Korea steals all our scientific ideas. Maybe he injected himself with bleach.
This week in Washington, protestors demonstrated outside the Trump International Hotel. They were objecting to the hotel bar's new signature cocktail, the Bleachy Mary.
Yesterday President Trump appeared to suggest that injecting disinfectant might kill the coronavirus. He also promoted his new medical adviser, Mr. Clean, to Dr. Clean.
Ruth's Chris Steak House will return the $20 million small-business loan it received from the government. When asked for comment, steak experts said, "Well done."
Today a village in the Netherlands had to be evacuated because of smoke from a wildfire. Dutch investigators say the fire started when a broken power line fell on a wooden shoe.

Today this year's National Spelling Bee was canceled because of the coronavirus. Contestants were so disappointed that they used the f-word, defined it as "to have sexual intercourse," spelled it, and repeated it.
Today the governor of Georgia said that on Friday all bowling alleys in the state can reopen. It'll be perfectly safe. Apparently the coronavirus is killed by the viruses in bowling shoes.
The Wuhan Institute of Virology in Wuhan, China, has denied that the coronavirus came from them. Then they announced their new name, the Wuhan Institute of Incredible Coincidences.
Now the FDA says that after you buy groceries you don't have to wipe down the food packaging. Apparently maple syrup lovers were getting too handsy with their bottles of Mrs. Butterworth's.
Today General Motors delivered its first medical ventilators. The bad news is, they charged an extra $10,000 each for dealer prep fee, fabric protection, and rustproof undercoating.
President Trump's name is going to be printed on those stimulus checks being mailed out. It actually makes sense. That way he can charge everybody for his autograph.
Today health products maker Johnson & Johnson said it's racing to develop a coronavirus vaccine. Also, because of social distancing, it changed its name to Johnson............&............Johnson.
Because of the coronavirus, armies of cannibalistic rats are fighting each other over food. If you don't believe me, now you can watch it as sports programming on ESPN.
Tomorrow on Netflix is a new episode of "Tiger King." In this special Easter edition, Joe Exotic crossbreeds a Bengal tiger with a marshmallow Peep.
This week the Chinese government reclassified dogs as pets rather than livestock. It's all part of their new national slogan, "One pandemic at a time."
Because of the coronavirus, AMC Theaters is very close to bankruptcy. Analysts predict they'll file for Chapter 11,1:45, 4:30, and a special Chapter 7:15 in IMAX.
The Chinese government has officially lifted quarantine restrictions on Wuhan. Proud officials say that Wuhan residents are ready and eager to get back to work creating a new virus.
Today a judge ruled that singer R. Kelly has to stay in jail during the coronavirus crisis. Apparently the judge was concerned that Kelly would have sex with COVID-19's younger sister, COVID-15.
Because of the coronavirus there's no word on when NBA basketball will resume. In fact, the New York Knicks are still under official orders to "suck at home."
Because of the coronavirus, Hobby Lobby stores in Ohio were ordered to close. Also ordered to close were restaurants Chuck E. Sneeze and The Sneezecake Factory, and big-box store Cough-co.
Can a computer ad-lib a joke? Yes! Join me online at this meetup on April 13, 2020, and I'll tell you how.
In New York City, there's a new field hospital for coronavirus patients in Central Park. It has the squirrels so concerned that they're rubbing Purell on their nuts.
The chairman of Disney is giving up his salary during the coronavirus outbreak. And in a new version of their animated classic, Prince Charming wakes up the deceased Snow White with an elbow bump.
President Trump announced that he's extending his coronavirus guidelines on social distancing until April 30. That means for another month, he plans to stay at least six feet away from the facts.
Yesterday President Trump signed a $2 trillion stimulus package. Experts say it's the biggest and most stimulating package they've ever seen outside of Jay Z's hot tub.
A new website can calculate how long your supply of toilet paper will last. You just input your height, your weight, and whether you eat at Chipotle.
The start of Major League Baseball is delayed because of the coronavirus. But the teams have to protect themselves. Like, now the Houston Astros are stealing face masks.
The medical adviser for the movie "Contagion" revealed that he has contracted the coronavirus. The good news is, his agent only contracted 10% of the virus.
U.S. officials are warning about increasing scams related to the coronavirus. On the plus side, they also reported that some Americans are going back to work--con artists.
Here's another health problem caused by the coronavirus: Dr. Anthony Fauci was listening to President Trump and rolled his eyes so hard he sprained them.
Today Google announced a website in the U.S. where you can go to get information about the coronavirus. They're calling it "Google."
Because of the coronavirus, New York City residents are taking social distancing very seriously. Like, now pickpockets are telling you to just toss them your wallet.
