The CDC says that people should get a flu shot by the end of October. So if you hate needles, don’t eat any of the CDC’s Halloween candy.
Thanks for writing that great joke for me to blog about!
Hurricane Florence has strengthened to a Category 4. That’s strong. To put that in perspective, the last Category 4 was Serena Williams at the US Open.
According to a new study, the least valuable college major is “Miscellaneous Fine Arts.” The good news is, that includes the fine art of small talk with your Uber passenger.
Today is International Literacy Day. President Trump celebrated by reading things and then demanding to know who wrote them.
Today the U.S. Postal Service unveiled a new stamp honoring the late Beatle John Lennon. But if you use it with the Yoko Ono stamp it won’t stick to the envelope.
Convicted funnyman Bill Cosby is facing a lawsuit over unpaid legal fees. But he’s not worried. He says he’s had a lot of practice getting out of his suits.
This is exciting. Today is National Cheese Pizza Day! There’s no topping that.
Today Brett Kavanaugh said that a good judge must be an “umpire.” As an example, he ruled that teachers have a lot of strikes and Trump has a lot of balls.
It’s Labor Day 2018. A lot of people had barbecues today. For some senators, it was great practice for grilling Brett Kavanaugh.
Recently the first commercial rocket launch took place successfully in Scotland. Well, more accurately, a big chunk of haggis shot out of a bagpipe.
Today the Department of Justice sided with Asian-American students in a lawsuit against Harvard. That’s because the DOJ wants to copy off them during the final exam.
Steve Jobs’s widow is criticizing a new memoir written by Steve Jobs’s daughter. Even worse, a newer, faster-reading memoir is coming out next week with twice the memories.
It was brutally hot today for U.S. Open tennis. It was so steamy that even the women had a problem with moist balls.
Happy Birthday today to Cesar "Dog Whisperer" Millan. His party was fun. His family played “Pin the Tail on the Donkey” and his dogs played “Spray the Urine on the Presents.”
Recently NASA released 19,000 hours of audio recordings from the historic Apollo 11 mission. 19,000 hours of recordings is a lot. That’s like Omarosa at the White House.
America’s national forests are being severely damaged by the illegal growing of marijuana. Which explains the new Forest Service mascot, Tokey the Bear.
NYC plans to revoke the ten taxi medallions of former Trump lawyer Michael Cohen. It’s a safety thing: The taxi cabs with those medallions keep flipping.
Last night Oregon was hit by a 6.2 magnitude earthquake. Seismologists say it was an aftershock of yesterday’s massive earthquake that shook the Oval Office.
Today President Trump got a standing ovation at a rally in West Virginia. The crowd wouldn’t stop clapping so, to keep them quiet, Trump paid them $150,000.
Today shares of electric car maker Tesla fell $3.86. Actually, first they went down $2.17, then they stopped for 6 hours to recharge, then they went down the rest of the way.
Former secretary-general of the United Nations Kofi Annan died today. The good news is that Russia vetoed it so it doesn’t count.
Elon Musk's Boring Company wants to build a tunnel to Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles. Says Musk, “When you think baseball, think Boring.”
Southwest Airlines is allowing miniature horses as service animals. And because it’s Southwest, they’re also allowing miniature horse in their inflight deli sandwiches.
Ethan Peck was just cast as Spock in "Star Trek: Discovery" on CBS All Access. He says his big Star Trek Discovery is that there’s something called “CBS All Access.”
A new report warns about an increase in the number of mosquito "disease danger days." Says President Trump, “See, it’s the mosquitoes. That’s why Melania swats at me all the time.”
933 people in California set a Guinness World Record for the most people making slime. The slime was made from glue, liquid starch, and bits of Harvey Weinstein.
Four women are suing Nike for fostering a work environment that allowed sexual harassment. It’s terrible. Apparently Nike even considered a new slogan, “Just Do Her.”
Next September, Cher is releasing a new album of ABBA songs. Coincidentally, A, B, B, and A are also how she grades her last four plastic surgeries.
Burger chain Jack in the Box is under fire for a TV commercial full of sexual innuendo. Apparently it’s pretty risqué. The commercial actually says the name of the company.
Recent tests found asbestos in Playskool brand crayons. Which explains the company’s new name, PlayLungDoctor.
A new report says that selfies and photo filters are driving more people to get plastic surgery. It also says that more men who want a selfie stick are taking Viagra.
In Las Vegas, two patrons were injured by a flaming drink at Gordon Ramsay's Hell’s Kitchen restaurant. To keep with the theme, they hired Hell’s Lawyer.
The Maine Lobster Festival Sea Goddess was forced to resign over 'inappropriate behavior.' When asked for comment, she clammed up.
A 19-year-old woman tattooed the signature of Patriots quarterback Tom Brady on her arm. The weird part is, her breasts deflated.
Scientists just confirmed Einstein’s theory of relativity again. The test involved a star. Apparently intense gravity bent the light in a selfie of Kim Kardashian’s ass.
A woman is suing Canada Dry because she says that its ginger ale does not contain real ginger. In response, real gingers said, “Amazing. A woman actually wants us.”
If you want to go somewhere fun today, it’s National Waterpark Day. The bad news is that it’s also National Incontinence Day.
The United Nations is warning that it’s running out of cash. But they have a plan to raise money. “I’ll send out some emails,” said a diplomat from Nigeria.
Two pilots were fighting at 37,000 feet in the cockpit of an Iraqi Airways flight. Apparently the pilots are former terrorists. They used to fly for 72 Virgin Airways.
A man who says he was bitten by a brown recluse spider on an American Airlines flight is now suing. On the plus side, the man was already in intense pain from the tight seats.
A new social media trend has people jumping out of moving cars to dance. Apparently the best dancers get cast in a new reality show, “So You Think You Can Die.”
In theaters this weekend is “Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again.”  It’s a tense thriller about any day in the Trump administration.
Visitors seem to be avoiding some U.S. national parks because of air pollution. It’s so bad that now every time Old Faithful erupts, the park rangers throw Altoids in it.
Ford is recalling over half a million vehicles that can roll away unexpectedly. In their defense, officials said, “That’s why we called it the Ford Escape.”
President Trump announced plans to build a new Air Force One. Like Trump, it’ll move fast and have a nice paint job but you won’t know where it’s going to go next.
Former CIA Director Brennan called President Trump's press conference in Helsinki treasonous. Trump responded, “What’s wrong with trees? I like trees.”
Recently eight critically endangered black rhinos died in Kenya. No word yet on what they did to offend Vladimir Putin.
This week Home Depot announced that it’s moving into the home decor category. They’re even opening a branch in North Korea called Home Despot.
This Sunday it’s France vs. Croatia in the World Cup soccer final. Analysts expect to see more European ball-kicking than when President Trump talked to NATO.
President Trump says he plans to give Kim Jong Un a CD of “Rocket Man” by Elton John. It’s a thoughtful gift, because most homes in North Korea don’t have an indoor John.
More than 200 people from four states were sickened after eating Del Monte Fresh Produce vegetable trays. That’s unbelievable. Americans were eating vegetables?
A new UN report urges nations to take better care of the world's forests. It’s an impressive report, printed on the finest Honduras rosewood vellum.
Recently Amazon was selling children’s products that promote white supremacy. Even worse, the kids’ products are also available at the store Toys Aryan Us.
Tonight pyrotechnicians in NYC will launch 75,000 aerial fireworks. Each firework will consist of gunpowder, chemicals, and pieces of the rat napping in the launch tube.
Visitors to Washington built a giant American flag out of LEGOs outside on the National Mall. The LEGO flag is dedicated to all those who died of heat stroke building it.
Disgraced film mogul Harvey Weinstein could face a life sentence for new alleged sex crimes. Life in prison, or as Weinstein puts it, “an ironclad deal with gross points.”
Large sections of the US are baking in a sweltering heat wave. It’s so hot that even progressive activists are saying that we need ICE.
In a new video, Arnold Schwarzenegger mocks President Trump's energy policy. Instead of coal, Arnold says we should get our energy from a more modern source: steroids.
A new survey says the state with the lowest percentage of adults who exercise regularly is Mississippi. That’s weird. Why aren’t more Mississippians running...away from Mississippi?
To get more breakfast customers, McDonald’s is looking at selling muffin tops. Apparently they got the idea by looking at their customers’ waists.
That Red Hen in Virginia asked Sarah Sanders to leave, and now even unaffiliated Red Hen restaurants are getting death threats. So if you own a Red Hen, you’re plucked.
In Chicago, a police dog sniffed out $10 million worth of marijuana. Apparently he sniffed it out last week but didn’t get around to telling his handler about it until today.
Today is the summer solstice, the longest day of the year. But tomorrow will be the longest day of the year if you’re an American and you watch a World Cup soccer game.
A CDC study says that obesity rates are surging in rural America. Which explains the new name for the Texas Panhandle: the Texas Love Handle.
To raise money, the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Museum may auction off his bloody gloves. Also up for auction, Lincoln’s white Ford Bronco and Heisman Trophy.
Recently in Hollywood, a Tesla car sitting in traffic burst into flames. Ironically, the driver was on his way to a protest rally against global warming.
Bill Cosby fired all seven lawyers on his legal team. He says that now he wants a new team of female lawyers to handle his briefs.
China plans to land a spacecraft on the dark side of the moon. It’s all part of their five-year mission to spy on every single lifeform in the universe.
Prosecutors in LA are reviewing a sex crime case against Sylvester Stallone. Stallone denied the allegations. Or maybe what he said was, “I don’t like the alligators.”
President Trump said that the U.S. will stop military exercises with South Korea. Kim Jong Un loves that. Just looking at him, you can tell he hates exercises.
Tesla is cutting about 4,000 jobs. But apparently it’s taking the workers a while to walk out because they keep crashing into walls.
Researchers have built a humanoid robot that’s programmed to hug. They’re trying to answer the question of why they can’t even get out of the friend zone with a robot.
Tyson Foods recalled 3,000 pounds of frozen chicken that contained pieces of plastic. Apparently the chickens contained plastic because they were raised in Beverly Hills.
Days before the summit, a Kim Jong Un impersonator was detained in Singapore. Even weirder, Donald Trump will be there impersonating the President of the United States.
Yesterday two climbers shattered a record by climbing Yosemite's 3000-foot El Capitan in under two hours. But it took them another three hours to relax their sphincters.
Analysts say that "Solo" may be the first “Star Wars” movie to lose money. They blame the poorly received new character, Roseanne Barr Barr Binks.
The Capella Hotel has been chosen as the venue for the Singapore summit meeting between President Trump and his most determined adversary, the Philadelphia Eagles.
EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt tried to buy a used mattress from the Trump Hotel. The mattress was a Stearns and Foster Luxury Plush Euro Pillowtop, like Trump’s head.
Kim Jong Un is demanding that someone else pay his hotel bill for the summit in Singapore. He’s also threatening to launch a full-scale attack on the minibar.
Samantha Bee's show “Full Frontal” lost at least two advertisers. But she did get strong support from her advertiser Hunt’s Tomato Sauce and its CEO, Mike Hunt.
Samantha Bee called Ivanka Trump a “feckless c-word.” Bee later apologized, saying that she had meant to pronounce “feckless” with a “u.”
Roseanne Barr blamed Ambien for her racist Twitter post. And apparently she had also taken three Vitamin Ks.
Today in NYC is Manhattanhenge, when the setting sun lines up with the street grid. It’s such a breathtaking sight that you won’t even mind when your pocket gets picked.
It’s Memorial Day, and even celebrities are having cookouts. If you’re going over to Charlie Sheen’s or Tiger Woods’s, you can’t go wrong with bringing porn on the cob.
Today New York City's eight public beaches opened for the summer. All the city dwellers are having fun in the sun. I even saw a cockroach surfing on a rat.
Tomorrow in NYC, Harvey Weinstein is set to turn himself in on sex crime charges. Apparently the evidence is so graphic, instead of a grand jury they had a groin jury.
The New York City Council is considering a ban on plastic straws. But as Red Sox fans put it, New York can always find new ways to suck.
The White House is under fire for a commemorative coin calling Kim Jong Un the “Supreme Leader.” Embarrassed officials say that the coin should have read “Supreme Eater.”
Consumer Reports says the Tesla Model 3 has poor brakes. So now Tesla tells drivers using Autopilot to keep one hand on the wheel and one foot dragging on the pavement.
The newly married Prince Harry was given the title Duke of Sussex. Not to be outdone, our President gave his youngest son the new name Barron of Trump.
Today the CEO of Campbell Soup suddenly announced that she’s retiring. She made the announcement by lining up the letters in her alphabet soup I M R E T I R I N G.
President Trump is sending a wedding gift to Meghan Markle and Prince Harry. It comes with a very sweet card that says, “You can’t talk about this. Signed, Michael Cohen.”
Today Sherpa Kami Rita set a record by completing his 22nd successful climb of Mount Everest. Unsurprisingly, he celebrated by getting high.
American Airlines has banned insects and snakes as inflight service animals. But insects and snakes will still be allowed on North Korean airlines as inflight snacks.
A NY auction house said that somebody had accidentally damaged a Picasso painting worth $70 million. The clumsy employee was said to be “all thumbs,” like the painting.
Yesterday NYC police stopped three men from stealing a mailbox. So now you have the perfect Mother’s Day excuse: “I mailed you a card, Ma. Somebody must’ve stolen the mailbox.”
Today President Trump outlined his plan to lower drug prices. Finally some good news for Bill Cosby.
The FCC fined a Florida man $120 million for making almost 100 million robocalls. They ordered the man to pay the fine a dollar at a time during his next 120 million dinners.
Today Madame Tussauds unveiled its wax figure of Meghan Markle. It’s very realistic. Just like the royal family, the wax figure will be admired but won’t really do anything.
A Nebraska woman's runny nose was actually fluid from inside her brain. Doctors attribute the woman’s leaking brain fluid to the show “Jersey Shore Family Vacation.”
Idaho State University was fined for losing a gram of weapons-grade plutonium. Officials blame the loss on the escalating conflict between the jocks and the nerds.
Security is extra tight at today’s Kentucky Derby. It’s so tight that, at the metal detector, the contenders have to take off their horseshoes.
A New York City restaurant is selling chicken wings dusted with 24-karat gold. Which answers the question: What’s on the menu at the next White House state dinner?
The Film Academy voted to expel Bill Cosby and Roman Polanski. Apparently the two men violated the high ethical standards that show business is famous for.
A Kansas woman took a used Mercedes for a test drive alone and never returned it. In her defense, the dealer told her the car was a steal.
The CDC says the number of Americans who got sick from mosquito, tick, or flea bites tripled over 13 years. That’s because Americans tripled in size, too, so the insects had bigger targets!
An Ohio woman has been arrested for stealing a rare butterfly. She’s charged with pretty larceny.
Kim Kardashian wants General Mills to bring back Dunkaroos. Apparently the cookie snack is the secret ingredient in Kim’s special recipe for a larger ass.
Temple University rescinded Bill Cosby’s honorary doctorate. So no more Dr. Cosby. They said that a real doctor would have billed women 200 bucks for each Quaalude.
Today Bill Cosby was found guilty on all counts. According to reports, Cosby’s lawyers are appealing, but Cosby himself is completely unappealing.
An island graveyard near New York City is eroding and leaving human bones on the shoreline. On the plus side, spectators say it looks like a bevy of supermodels sunbathing.
A British bookie predicts that the name of the new royal baby will be Arthur. So if you made a big bet on the baby name Arthur, the odds are excellent that you have no life.
Today in the Bill Cosby trial, the defense rested. More accurately, after meeting with Cosby, they slipped into a drug-induced stupor.
It’s Earth Day 2018. To show his respect for nature, Harvey Weinstein walked right past a potted plant and didn’t do anything.
Baltimore is banning Styrofoam food and drink containers because of health and environmental concerns. Nice try, Baltimore. We’re still not living there.
Time magazine revealed its list of the 100 most influential people in the world. It’s their way of thanking the 100 people who still read Time magazine.
A new study says that Americans waste nearly a pound of food each per day. Americans couldn’t believe it, saying “We’re eating as much food as we can!”
The New York Times and The New Yorker won a Pulitzer Prize for covering the Harvey Weinstein scandal. And Harvey Weinstein’s bathrobe won a Pulitzer for covering his lap.
The Russian Foreign Minister strongly denied that Syria used chemicals against innocent people. Then he added, “But Bill Cosby totally did.”
It’s Friday the 13th, a very unlucky day. In fact, President Trump is having such a bad day that he threatened to fire the Lucky Charms leprechaun.
An NYU professor says that new clothes can harbor fecal bacteria. Listen, if you have fecal bacteria in your clothes, they’re way, way too tight.
The DEA seized hundreds of counterfeit Disney figurines filled with meth. Apparently they were part of a new plan to make the lines at Disneyland go faster.
Supermarket chain Kroger is adding 11,000 supermarket workers. Even better, Kroger said that last month they added 11,000 obese customers.
When he testifies in Congress tomorrow, Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg will wear a suit. The suit is an Italian brand: Giorgio Apology.
Bakersfield, Calif., now has a post office named for country music legend Merle Haggard. Which makes sense, because “Merle” is how country folk say “mail.”
A new study says that older adults can still grow new brain cells. Which explains the popularity of the game: three-dimensional Bingo.
A new study says that Facebook is being used to promote tobacco products. Apparently Facebook wants users to calm down about privacy by having a relaxing smoke.
In Turkey, a squirrel who lost both his arms was given prosthetic wheels so he could walk again. The wheels even came with a little basket to hold his nuts.
A new poll says that older Americans support medical marijuana use. So very soon there could be Medicare, Obamacare, and Willie-Nelson-Care.
Today Arnold Schwarzenegger described waking up after heart surgery. Apparently his face wasn’t moving and he was hard to understand. That’s how doctors knew he was back to normal.
Today in Cambridge, England, was the funeral of famous physicist Stephen Hawking. The attendees were very somber. Even the black holes were unusually black.
A new report says last year LaGuardia Airport had the highest rate of flight cancellations. But this is nice: LGA officials are giving the report to stranded passengers to use as a pillow.
Today Joe Biden denounced what he called "the prostitution of the Second Amendment." And Congress was like, “Interesting. How much does the Second Amendment charge?”
Today Facebook promised to “put people more in control of their privacy.” So now users can easily choose where their private data goes: to the Russians or to the Chinese.
A man was arrested for mailing suspicious packages to DC area buildings including the White House. As before, the White House package was handled by Stormy Daniels.
This weekend, pieces of an out-of-control Chinese space lab may fall out of the sky and hit the United States. Trump is right! These Chinese imports are killing us!
Today Facebook was hit with a class-action lawsuit for failing to protect user data. The class-action lawsuit accuses Facebook of having no class and taking no action.
Today President Trump signed a $1.3 trillion spending bill. And that was just for payments to his mistresses.
A Saudi crown prince apparently said that Jared Kushner was "in his pocket." That’s shocking. Who knew those robes had pockets?
Today Mark Zuckerberg promised to help Facebook users protect their personal data. He said now users can either click on “Share my data” or “Don’t not share my data.”
The FDA might restrict menthol-flavored cigarettes, which appeal to young people. The problem is, maybe then the kids would switch to that Cool Ranch cocaine.
Today President Trump banned the use of a cryptocurrency issued by Venezuela. He said the U.S. has no place for sketchy financial transactions that aren’t his.
A Swiss student invented a machine that folds paper airplanes. Even better, now he has a use for all his rejected prom invitations.
Today a judge agreed to let five more accusers of Bill Cosby testify at his retrial. Cosby’s lawyers were angry and Cosby hit the roofie.
It’s March 14, Pi Day. But this is weird: today Pi is only 3 because President Trump fired 1, 4, 1, 5, 9, 2, 6, 5, 3...
Looks like Gina Haspel will be the first female director of the CIA. Even better, she got to be a female director without having to meet Harvey Weinstein.
A NH judge ruled that a woman who won a $560 million Powerball jackpot can stay anonymous. So court records refer to her as “Jane Rolling-in-Doe.”
Costco is selling a doomsday meal kit in case of natural disasters. It features 36,000 servings of food, which is twice as many as their regular-size meal kit.
Thousands of cheerleaders at a competition may have been exposed to the mumps. Apparently they may have been infected when they shouted, “Give me an M, give me a U, give me an M...”
In D.C. the Interior Department is spending $139,000 to fix three sets of double doors. That’s weird. Usually when you hear “unhinged” it’s about the White House.
The Arctic just finished its warmest winter on record. It’s so warm that President Trump wants to open up the Arctic to drilling for iced tea.
Russ Solomon, the founder of Tower Records, passed away. Funeral services will be in the Spoken Word section under “S.”
Saudi Arabia hosted its first-ever footrace for women. It was cool. The finish line was in a sports stadium and the starting line was in the thirteen century.
Up for Best Picture at the Academy Awards is “Get Out.” It’s about a young man who gradually realizes he’s in the Trump administration.
A massive nor'easter is forcing hundreds of flights to be canceled. Good news for President Trump. It’ll be harder for officials in his administration to escape.
A major storm is about to hit the East Coast. Experts predict the wind gusts will be so strong that Melania might actually grab President Trump’s hand.
A Polish company is selling a pair of socks that look like Adolf Hitler. Even worse is a pair of shoes they call “Heil heels.”
A Pennsylvania man with red sauce on his face was charged with stealing meatballs. He’s being defended by the law firm of Chef and Boyardee.
A new study says that one in seven teens are sending sexts, which explains their favorite photo-sharing website, Pimpterest.
More Winter Olympics news: the U.S. men’s curling team won gold medals. But it took forever because the men kept knocking each other off the podium.
At the Winter Olympics, a second Russian athlete failed a doping test. On the plus side, now the Russians are leading the medal count in pairs urination.
Climate scientists are discussing whether to add a new category of storm, Category 6. But the storms named after men say they’re really Category 7-and-a-half.
An executive is leaving Ford Motor Company after reports of “inappropriate behavior.” Apparently he was so handsy his nickname was the “Ford Explorer.”
Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos is building a 500-foot-tall cuckoo clock in a mountain in Texas. Asked when the cuckoo comes out, Bezos replied, “I’m standing right here.”
It’s Presidents Day 2018, a federal holiday. So here’s what’s closed: post offices, banks, and Harvey Weinstein’s bathrobe.
A new president was just elected for U.S. Soccer. It was weird. Apparently he got no votes for over an hour then he got one vote.
Tonight, the opening ceremony of the Winter Olympics. Not to be outdone, Harvey Weinstein staged an opening ceremony for his bathrobe.
A New Jersey police officer lost her job because she previously worked as a dominatrix. Apparently she thought the right to remain silent involved a ball gag.
A New Jersey police officer lost her job because she previously worked as a dominatrix. On the plus side, they let her keep the handcuffs.
Now some yoga classes are combining yoga with marijuana smoking. One popular pose is the Downward Snacking Dog.
A South Carolina man destroyed a toilet and flooded a strip club. The good news is, they called for a plumber and thirty-seven showed up.
Today the Dow posted its worst one-day point drop in history. NBC News said the Dow dropped faster than Matt Lauer’s boxer shorts.
New research says that all that pecking may give woodpeckers brain damage. Which explains why Woody Woodpecker was never an NFL mascot.
Tomorrow is Groundhog Day. To celebrate, Harvey Weinstein is inviting women to watch what emerges from his bathrobe.
The Super Bowl will have really tight security. Like during the halftime show, 40 officers will surround Justin Timberlake to prevent a reunion of NSYNC.
Steven Spielberg is making a fifth “Indiana Jones” movie with Harrison Ford. It’s about a legendary ancient relic searching for another legendary ancient relic.
Today USA Gymnastics said its entire board of directors will resign. The directors said they would leave doing an aerial walkover forward with a full twist.
In California, a former Disney star was arrested in a string of armed robberies. Terrible. His victims said he took all their money, like Disneyland.
Today a judge sentenced that sex abuser gymnastics doctor to up to 175 yrs. in prison. The other judges gave him 172 yrs., 178 yrs., and only 106 yrs...the Russian judge.
This just in: 13 Oscar nominations for “The Shape of Water.” To mark the occasion, Harvey Weinstein is inviting women to meet his lizard monster.
Tonight in Philadelphia, Bill Cosby is performing a surprise comedy concert. He says his ticket policy for female fans will be first come, first unconscious.
A new proposal says driving into Manhattan could cost a motorist $11.52. It’s being supported by the National Council for Exact Change.
Arizona officials guaranteed that even if there’s a government shutdown the Grand Canyon will not close. Harvey Weinstein guaranteed the same about his bathrobe.
San Francisco police recovered two stolen costumes belonging to an Olympic figure skater. They knew they were getting close when their bloodhound inhaled a sequin.
A new report says that last year Americans received 30 billion robocalls. To stop robocalls, please keep reading and you’ll be connected to the next available operator.
Some Californians want to create a new state called New California. Apparently the first step would be to smooth out the San Andreas Fault with Botox.
The worker who sent that false missile alert in Hawaii has been reassigned. Apparently he’ll go back to his old job announcing winners at the Academy Awards.
A former U.S. Postal Service worker pleaded guilty to burning mail for months. Prison experts say he’ll get a Forever Sentence.
Today, for the first time, Saudi women were allowed into a stadium to watch soccer. They were so excited that for three minutes they stayed awake.
Kohler just introduced a smart toilet powered by Alexa. It’s so smart, it knows exactly when to order more canned corn.
Today the American Kennel Club added to its official roster two more breeds of dog. So congratulations to Kevin Spacey and Harvey Weinstein.
North Korean figure skaters might compete at the Olympics in South Korea. They don’t care about winning. They just want to eat the roses people throw on the ice.
According to the CDC, we’re going through a brutal flu season. It’s so bad, Jeff Sessions just legalized recreational Tamiflu.
This weekend, frigid cold weather is gripping the East Coast. But President Trump is keeping warm. He’s burning piles of Michael Wolff’s book.
Nissan unveiled a way for drivers to control a car using their brain waves. So if you’re a member of Congress, you’ll be taking the Metro.
It's so cold in Florida that iguanas are falling from trees. Which explains why, during hurricanes, Floridians say, “It’s raining cats and iguanas.”
Two executives were suspended by Vice Media after a report about sexual misconduct. This was right after the men were promoted for inventing two new vices.
A lot of people celebrated New Year’s Eve with a party. Even Harvey Weinstein invited women to watch the ball drop in his bathrobe.
Stepping down as CEO, the founder of the Papa John’s pizza chain. Experts predict it could cause a Domino’s Effect.
This is one of the busiest weeks of the year for air travel. On the plus side, Matt Lauer offered to help the TSA give pat-downs.
A baby was born from an embryo that had been frozen for 24 years. The baby was named after her longtime neighbors, Ben & Jerry.
Race car drivers Danica Patrick and Ricky Stenhouse Jr. are ending their relationship. You know what they say: Even Formula One isn’t Love Potion No. 9.
President Trump calls the new Republican tax plan a great gift to the middle class. But his critics call it a great gift to their middle finger.
Now in theaters, the new “Star Wars” movie. To celebrate, Harvey Weinstein found a potted plant and gave himself a Hand Solo.
Today the Northeast U.S. was hit with the coldest air of the season. It was so cold that Harvey Weinstein actually closed his bathrobe halfway.
Using special ocean seismometers, scientists have recorded the Earth humming. The weird part is, the Earth didn’t even realize it was doing it.
Celebrity chef Mario Batali was accused of inappropriate touching. He warned the media to take the accusations with a grain of salt and a pinch of paprika.
South Korea is having a problem with counterfeit Winter Olympics products. But it’s okay because the Russians are secretly replacing the bad products with good products.
Today Pfizer announced it will begin selling a generic version of Viagra for half the price. Finally some good news for the unemployed Charlie Rose.
A company is now making a super-sized mattress that’s 12 feet wide. Apparently Harvey Weinstein wants one for casting crowd scenes.
Accused of sexual abuse, conductor James Levine was suspended from the Metropolitan Opera. But you know the saying: It ain’t over till the fat lady is deposed.
The latest prominent man accused of sexual misconduct is playwright Israel Horovitz. It’s terrible. He even had a sign on his fly reading, “Standing Room Only.”
Today the East Coast was rocked by a 4.1 magnitude earthquake. The ground shook so hard that Matt Lauer accidentally groped himself.
Today Russia unveiled the uniforms for its athletes at the winter Olympics. Admirers described the Russian uniforms as “dope.”
President Trump is working on a plan to bail out failing coal plants. He says Santa’s going to need all that coal to put in Democrats’ stockings.
Today is Cyber Monday. Over 200 million people are expected to go online, and that’s just the Russian hackers.
Today is Small Business Saturday. So Harvey Weinstein is keeping his bathrobe open 24 hours and gift-wrapping his package.
Everybody have a good Thanksgiving? Harvey Weinstein ate so much he had to loosen his belt and take off his pants and underwear.
A new poll shows 1 in 3 Americans dreads political talk over Thanksgiving. They also dread Charlie Rose asking them if they want his special gravy.
Today in Philadelphia a neurologist pleaded guilty to charges that he groped patients. A neurologist! What a nerve!
In New York, 33 people were injured in explosions at a cosmetics factory. The victims were treated at the scene for extreme makeover.
Today a Japanese tug boat drifted into a U.S. Navy destroyer. The Navy is outraged but the tug boat claims the touching was consensual.
A consultant identified a fire risk caused by a huge buildup of human hair in Washington D.C. Metro tunnels. Officials are shocked: Trump takes the Metro?

A government shutdown is only hours away. If it happens it’ll close the National Zoo in DC, or as most people refer to it, Congress.

The No. 2 officer in charge of U.S. nukes was suspended for gambling. Apparently whenever anybody called a bomber a B-52 he yelled, “Bingo!”
Everybody in DC is worried about a government shutdown. To raise money, the statue of Jefferson is giving the statue of Lincoln a lap dance.
A new plant grows both tomatoes and potatoes. It’s perfect for gardeners who can’t decide if they want a tomato, a potato, or a Ritalin.
Team USA is now battling Team New Zealand in the America’s Cup. When asked to comment, most Americans were like, “That’s soccer, right?”
A 1911 Mary Pickford film was found in a NH barn. Rotten Tomatoes rated the film 63% Fresh. They’re still checking on Mary Pickford.
Tests prove that the new iPhone 5S is more fragile than the previous model. In fact, if you stream “The Notebook” on it Siri starts sobbing.
In a Paris airport 30 suitcases were found full of cocaine.Officials became suspicious when the baggage carousel started spinning at 83 mph.
A CA woman who is 8 ½ months pregnant is still lifting weights. And to prepare for breastfeeding she’s doing pushups without using her arms.
A “Wheel of Fortune” contestant lost a shot at $1 million by mispronouncing a word. On his next turn he bought the producers an F and a U.
Starbucks is now asking customers not to bring guns. In a related story, Starbucks just announced the new price of a cup of coffee is $14.
Today the cruise ship Costa Concordia was pulled upright using 22 hydraulic pumps. It’s the same equipment Larry King uses to have sex.
Tonight Justin Sargent starts on Broadway as the new Spiderman. Before the show he’ll sign autographs and tomorrow you can sign his cast.
Police accidently shot 2 bystanders in Times Square. The tourists weren’t badly hurt because the bullets first went thru their pickpockets.
This week the world’s shortest woman toured New York City. Not her choice...she was dragged around by the world’s largest rat.
United Airlines will honor tickets that it accidently sold for $5. The buyers will be allowed to check one bag free with themselves inside.
In Houston, three robbers assaulted employees of a Radio Shack. The robbers’ lawyer blames it on a misunderstanding of the word “battery.”
A judge ruled that NYC lap dancers deserve to be paid a salary. Apparently he saw how tough the job is when the customer is in a black robe.
Krispy Kreme Doughnuts is opening a shop in Moscow. It’s for tourists who crave another glazed treat after seeing the corpse of Lenin.
Kim Jong-un is planning an America/North Korea basketball tournament. North Korean rules will apply: sink a basket and you can eat the ball.
Wash. DC agency proposes a 24-hr waiting period to get a tattoo. That’d make it even harder for Congress to tell their ass from their elbow.
The IOC just revealed the host of the 2020 Summer Olympics: Tokyo. They also announced the first official sponsor: Midori Green Steroids.
Scientists just found a massive underwater volcano. It’s pretty close to Japan, which explains why it’s full of fossilized ramen noodles.
CDC says 10% of US high school students have tried an e-cigarette. That’s shocking because only 8% of US students can spell “e-cigarette.”
There’s a popular new video game: Disney’s “Infinity.” It’s an amazing simulation of standing in the line for Splash Mountain.
For Xmas Costco is already selling its own brand of Nativity Set. It’s perfect for families who believe there were actually 12 Baby Jesuses.
Diana Nyad completed her 103-mile swim to Fla. To celebrate, she’s going to Disney World by crawling another 297 miles on her hands & knees.
Diana Nyad is doing well on her Cuba-to-Florida swim,her 5th try. No jellyfish stings so far, thanks to a new route around Jellyfish Island.
President Obama is considering a “limited act” against Syria. That’s why he’s seeking the advice of a limited actor—Kristen Stewart.
It’s Labor Day Weekend. Over 1 million people are planning to leave town for a quick getaway, and that’s just Syrian soldiers watching CNN.
A Vegas casino wants to evict a raunchy nightclub. The problem is the Texas Hold ’Em: one showgirl is from Texas and she lets you hold ’em.
Today the U.S. sent a huge spy satellite into orbit. It’s so big that Edward Snowden just bought every thumb drive in the Moscow Best Buy.
On sale for $2.7 million: the LA home of boxer Manny Pacquiao. It features 5 bedrooms, 6 bathrooms, and a heated, Olympic-sized spit bucket.
The Farmers’ Almanac predicts a bitterly cold winter. This was right after they launched their new line: Farmer Al’s Patented Long Johns.
Accused sex harasser San Diego Mayor Bob Filner resigned.He’s looking forward to clearing out his desk because he enjoys touching its knobs.
Ben Affleck is getting in shape to play Batman. The workouts are intense. Apparently he’s bench-pressing crates of unsold “Daredevil” DVDs.
1000s of men in PA were given faulty prostate cancer tests. The men are so angry that they all feel like giving some a**hole the finger.
David Cassidy,star of “The Partridge Family”,was arrested for DWI. No word yet on how this will affect his new band: The Wild Turkey Family.
The maternity dress worn by Kate Middleton in an official photo sold out immediately. And men are snapping up the Prince William bald wig.
A Ball State freshman won free tuition for a semester by sinking a half-court basketball shot. He immediately declared his major: Beer Pong.
Last week at least six people were mauled by bears. Rangers advise hikers to avoid wearing the Axe body spray scent “Frightened Bear Cub.”
A NY parking meter-man was sentenced to 2 ½ years in prison. Actually it was 2 years but the guy whose cell he moved into had 6 months left.
A Miami woman gave birth on a hospital lobby floor. The billing department felt so cheated that it charged her $13,000 for new floor wax.
Chinese zoo is under fire for replacing a lion with a dog. Officials apologized, saying the dog must have escaped from the concession stand.
The San Diego Hooters banned sexual harasser Mayor Bob Filner. So now his favorite lunch spot is the San Diego Zoo’s Petting Paddock.
North Korea says it’s making its own smartphone. It’s perfect for North Koreans because when they pick it up it reminds them not to eat it.
Hyperloop transport would whisk passengers from LA to SF at the speed of sound. It’s for people who really hate LA and really love vomiting.
Sweden now has testicle-eating fish. That’s why the Stockholm Long John Silver’s just added a new Surf ‘n’ Turf special.
A Utah beauty queen was arrested for throwing homemade bombs. On the plus side: now she has a talent for the Miss al-Qaeda Pageant.
BREAKING: Boston Bomber friends Tazhayakov and Kadyrbayev are charged with obstructing justice and obstructing the spelling of their names.
Yesterday in Manhattan a 2-foot dead shark was found in a subway car. Sadly, the shark was only a foot away from a lifesaving pool of urine.
Conde Nast Traveler named Newark “World’s Unfriendliest City.” Newark promptly named Conde Nast Traveler “World’s Scratchiest Toilet Paper.”
A researcher unveiled a burger made of lab-grown beef from engineered stem cells. He says it’s for people who want good taste and hooves.
Oprah asks Lindsay Lohan in an interview, “Are you an addict?” Then Oprah tearfully confesses her own addiction to Lindsay Lohan interviews.
Edward Snowden was offered a job by Russia’s version of Facebook. It’s just like our Facebook except the little thumbs-up means “leak.”
A running of the bulls is being organized in the U.S. People will be chased by bulls released 6 at a time, followed by a wave of 27 lawyers.
On sale this fall: a new variety of apple, RubyFrost. Because it’s a new apple, only 6 months later it’ll be replaced by the RubyFrost 5S.
NSA leaker Edward Snowden was just granted asylum by Russia. President Obama is so furious that he ordered the IRS to audit Yakov Smirnoff.
TGI Fridays in NJ was fined $500,000 for serving cheap booze. They promised from now on they’ll get customers drunk and pick their pockets.
Two Detroit police officers are accused of armed robbery. Authorities are shocked to find out there was something in Detroit worth stealing.
Amazon is hiring 7,000 workers. They only wanted 2,000 workers but companies that hired these workers also hired these 5,000 other workers.
The USA men’s soccer team won the 2013 CONCACAF Gold Cup. The team MVP is given the gold cup to wear instead of his plastic one.
A San Francisco hotel is serving food like the prisoners ate at Alcatraz. For $28 you get an entree, a dessert, and a fork in your eyeball.
San Diego Mayor Bob Filner faces more allegations of harassment. Nearby SeaWorld accuses him of inappropriate touching of Shamu’s blowhole.
Near Los Angeles, researchers found a plague-infected squirrel. To keep it away from everybody they chased it into a screening of “R.I.P.D.”
A British researcher has discovered how to power cell phones with urine. Perfect for Geraldo: “What nude selfie? I was charging my Samsung.”
Kate Middleton is about to give birth. The baby’s gender will be announced as soon as her fetal monitor is hacked by the NSA.
As of today Belgium has a new king, Philippe. The previous Belgian king had to resign when he developed an allergy to waffles.
KFC may drop its mascot, Col. Sanders. Apparently the Colonel got his secret chicken recipe of 11 herbs and spices by waterboarding Popeye.
A Michigan Burger King employee hid marijuana in a Kids Meal box.Harsh laws mean he’ll probably be sentenced to keep working at Burger King.
The Royal Baby is five days overdue. To get the baby to come out, doctors have offered it asylum in Bolivia.
New “Rolling Stone” cover makes Boston Bomber look like rock star. The good news: it’ll make him even more popular in the prison shower.
Asiana is suing KTVU for airing those fake pilot names.The suit says KTVU staffers are so incompetent that they qualify to be Asiana pilots.
There’s a heat wave in New York City. To cool off, Anthony Weiner is tweeting photos of his Popsicle.
Qatar bought 118 tanks to prepare for the 2022 World Cup.They say they’re for security but the gun barrels are the diameter of soccer balls.
Today is National French Fry Day. To celebrate, Edward Snowden sent an asylum application to McDonalds.
This weekend Twinkies will be on sale at Walmart. They’re bound to be a hit because many Walmart customers are also spongy and lard-filled.
The inventor of the party game “Twister” died. He had nine children, which proves he also invented “Naked Twister."
Russia plans to build a nuclear power plant that floats. Concerned experts warn that it may result in a new Michael Bay movie.
Facebook just announced its list of America’s Ten Fittest Cities. They put it together by listing which American cities don’t use Facebook.
“The Lone Ranger” opened in South Korea to under $2 million. North Korea’s Kim Jong-un threatens to retaliate with an even bigger bomb.
In Germany trees were discovered planted in the shape of a swastika. Historians blame Johnny Appleseed’s Nazi grandson, Heinrich Appleseed.
NSA leaker Edward Snowden is offered asylum by Venezuela. Experts predict if he goes there he’ll keep leaking thanks to Montezuma’s Revenge.
It’s the day after July 4th. NYC drivers are politer than usual. That’s because some of them accidentally blew off their middle fingers.
This Fourth of July the biggest parade in the U.S. is people marching to ticket counters to get their refunds for “The Lone Ranger.”
A Fla. woman was rescued in the Everglades after an alligator bit her inflatable kayak.She says she was training for an Ironmoron Triathlon.
Edward Snowden’s father compares him to Paul Revere. But witnesses say after ten days in an airport he smells more like Paul Revere’s horse.
On the market: the $19 million estate of billionaire Howard Hughes. It has 5 bedrooms, 4 baths, and a refrigerated 1000-bottle urine cellar.
Jennifer Lopez sang “HappyBirthday” to the repressive leader of Turkmenistan. Paula Deen is upset. She didn’t get to make his birthday cake.
Paula Deen lost her multi-million-dollar book deal with Random House. So soon she’ll have to move out of her mansion into some random house.
Last Saturday George Lucas got married. Among the prominent guests were Ron Howard, Steven Spielberg, and Lucas’s three chins.
Target Corp. cut its ties with Paula Deen. Instead they signed up a new spokesperson they’re calling “Mr. Target”: Edward Snowden.
Paula Deen was just dropped by Caesar’s Casinos. Deen apologizes and promises that if they take her back she’ll “always bet on black.”
Pork producer Smithfield Foods drops Paula Deen. Apparently her “Good-Ol’ Country Breakfast” recipe says, “Arrange the bacon into three Ks.”
Ecuadorian officials were told by NSA leaker Edward Snowden that he fears for his life. They believed him because of the leak in his khakis.
Tonight in New York everybody has Supermoon fever. Even Anthony Weiner says he’ll appear 14% larger than usual.
Vladimir Putin claims that Patriots owner Robert Kraft gave him a Super Bowl ring. Kraft responded by also giving Putin the finger.
FBI admits it uses drones in the U.S. for aerial surveillance. Use is limited to hostage situations and Sofia Vergara tanning in her thong.
To maintain public support the NSA may change its surveillance program. New top priority would be intercepting photos of Kim & Kanye’s baby.
Police found the “Tanning Mom” drunk at an airport. Apparently she was upset because a baggage handler thought she was a leather suitcase.
Google is launching hi-altitude Wi-Fi Internet balloons.The reason: many remote areas don’t have access to fast, affordable lack of privacy.
The latest fad among Japanese teens is licking each other’s eyeballs. That explains why sales are taking off for new Visine with Soy Sauce.
Rocker Keith Richards says his drug use was an “experiment” that had to end. His new experiment: daily transfusions of embalming fluid.
Investigators may know where Edward Snowden is hiding in Hong Kong. Apparently the NSA picked up suspicious chatter in some fortune cookies.
Last Saturday in Colorado high winds caused 4 hot air balloons to crash. The balloons hit the ground so hard they were twisted into poodles.
Astronomers found a faint galaxy orbiting the Milky Way and say it’s the most lightweight group of stars they’ve seen since the Tony Awards.
High school students may be getting free condoms in Boston. At least the kids won’t be encouraged to have sex. The brand is “Old Ironsides.”

Skier Lindsey Vonn had to give a urine sample at a fashion event. She was held up by a line at the bathroom of six models waiting to vomit.
Ben & Jerry’s will no longer use genetically modified organisms in its ice cream. So now Chunky Monkey will be made with 100% real monkey.
Imports of US wheat that may have been genetically modified were halted by Japan. Scientists were afraid the wheat could turn into Godzilla.
Eight people arrested for rioting at a kindergarten graduation. If they go to jail they’ll learn a whole new way to play Duck, Duck, Goose.
On Friday a huge asteroid will fly past Earth but scientists aren’t worried. They say you’re more likely to get hit by Amanda Bynes’s bong.
Larry King will host a new political talk show on “Russia Today.” The Russians hired him when they couldn’t get Lenin’s embalmed corpse.
A Chinese company plans to buy into Club Med. The clubs will stay the same except before you can leave you’ll have to assemble 16,000 iPads.
Today NYC launched its bike share program w/ 6000 bikes. It’s perfect for New Yorkers who are into sharing things like bikes and ass rashes.
Brazilian Tony Kanaan won the Indy 500. That makes him the most famous Brazilian since the paps photographed Miley Cyrus going commando.
Investigators think a trucker may have hit that bridge in Washington. They suspect him because right before it collapsed he shouted “Jenga.”
President Obama forgot to salute the Marine he passed as he boarded Marine One. Immediately the IRS audited the President's right hand.
Authorities say 13 TGI Fridays were selling cheap liquor in premium brand bottles. The company claims it’s a new promotion: TGI Fraudays.
Tests show rice in China is tainted with toxic cadmium. Chinese officials are outraged. The cadmium was supposed to go into children’s toys.
Digitimes reports that the next iPad will weigh 25% less than the previous model. Even better, it’ll weigh 100% less when it’s stolen.
A Senate panel says Apple paid no taxes on $74 billion in income. Apple’s CEO blames two rogue Genius Bar agents in the Cincinnati office.
A NYC bakery just started selling the cronut, which is half croissant, half donut. It’s perfect for people on the French Policeman Diet.
The winning Powerball ticket was sold in Florida. No word yet on the winner’s name. Of course if he lives in Florida he may not remember it.
The Powerball jackpot is up to $600 million. The winners will take home about $260 million after tax or $3 if they belong to the Tea Party.
CDC says almost 60% of public pools are contaminated with feces. Apparently some swimmers have a loose definition of the term “freestyle.”
Yahoo says Boston Bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev has many female fans. He’s coming out with a new shampoo just for them: Veiled Head & Shoulders.
The IRS scandal continues to widen. Now they’re accused of auditing a Popeye’s Fried Chicken because it serves right wings.
Rich NYC moms hire disabled guides to skip the lines at Disney World. Each mom also gets a free Snow White hat with her dwarf name: Sleazy.
Dept. of Justice secretly seized phone records of The Associated Press. Their defense: the AP is in Verizon’s Friends & Family & Feds Plan.
O J Simpson appeared in court and he had gained a lot of weight. Apparently he finally found the Real Killer: those delicious prison donuts.
It’s Mother’s Day at the Betty Ford Center. Lindsay Lohan made her mother a present – a deluxe assortment of chocolate-covered Adderall.
An electrical transformer in the White House overheated. The cause: Pres. Obama was using only one wall outlet to recharge all his drones.
The May 4th SAT test was cancelled in all of South Korea. This created a huge problem because it left North Korea with nobody to copy off.
Huggies Brazil is testing an app that tweets you when your baby pees. And if baby has a BM, the app blogs about Carnival Cruises.
USAF strips 17 officers of power to launch nuclear missiles.The reason: a birthday party where they played “Pin the Tail on the Red Button.”
A poll says Kristen Stewart is the least-trusted movie star in America. But another poll says she’s the most-trusted star in BadActorLand.
Tourism minister says booze is OK in Egypt. He also announced Egyptian Happy Hour: from 4-7 PM it’s okay to beat drunk tourists with sticks.
It’s Cinco de Mayo. To celebrate, Kim Jong-un threatened to rain down a sea of flames on a piñata.
Fans celebrated Star Wars Day today, May the Fourth. They had so much fun that next year they’re celebrating a day earlier, on May the Nerd.
A boy, 14, hired a hooker who pepper-sprayed him then stole his piggy-bank. He said it was for a project he was doing on how Congress works.
2013 Calgary Stampede will offer new foods like Double Bacon Corndogs & Deep-Fried Butter. That explains their new event: Ambulance Races.
Fast-food chains are now the top dining choice in France. Experts say that’s because fast food is easier to eat while you’re surrendering.
AP says some New Yorkers train their dogs to hunt alley rats. That’s a problem because other New Yorkers train the rats to hunt cockroaches.
Climbers on Mt Everest got into a fight with sherpas fixing their ropes. “Hey, Everest is boring. Let’s piss off the guys fixing the ropes.”
The mother of the accused Boston Marathon bombers may have discussed jihad. Apparently she urged her son to wear a warm “suicide sweater.”
FAA is ending furloughs. This means now air traffic controllers can quit their temp jobs directing traffic around George Clooney’s bedroom.
A Brazilian cleaning his harpoon gun accidently shot himself in the head. He didn’t suffer any brain damage because he was already an idiot.
Survey reveals most popular restaurants for cheating spouses. Among them: Chili’s, P.F. Chang’s, and Outback-Behind-the-Dumpster Steakhouse.
Coming in Oct., a new $100 bill. Security features include color-changing ink, a 3-D ribbon, and a revealing full-body scan of Ben Franklin.
Starting today video gamers can order pizza directly through their Xbox 360. So now it’s even easier for users of the Xbox 360 to weigh 360.
Now there’s a diamond iPhone worth $15 mill. It’s the perfect gift for someone who has everything except a story about how they were robbed.
Western Mexico rocked by a magnitude-5.9 earthquake. No immediate reports of injuries. Residents enjoying candy from poorly made piñatas.
A Chinese auto manufacturer is coming out with a new SUV, the H7. It’s called the H7 because most of the workers who make it are age 7.
NASA excited to discover an Earth-like alien world: Kepler-62f. Believes it could theoretically support “The Real Housewives of Kepler-62f.”
Lance Armstrong just bought a 12,000 sq. ft. house. It has 5 bedrooms, 6.5 bathrooms, and a 4-car garage big enough to hold his ego.
Two NJ men were arrested for selling heroin on Craigslist. In their defense, they were also selling used Bowflex machines in crack houses.
In PA a woman was arrested for walking through a Walmart naked. Customers were outraged that she wasn’t wearing a bathrobe like they were.
2 NFL draft prospects left their hotel room covered in urine and feces. On the plus side,they just signed an endorsement deal with Carnival.
This weekend three Disneyland rides were closed for safety reviews: the Matterhorn Bobsleds, Space Mountain, and the Kim Jong-ungle Cruise.
The actress who played Pippi Longstocking was arrested for assault. It was hard to ID her because she pulled the longstocking over her head.
A former NY drug lord is running exercise classes for senior citizens. Now the only crack he deals with is the occasional fractured pelvis.
A new French study says that young women should stop wearing bras. The study was published in the prestigious Journal of Lonely Frenchmen.
Carnival is now offering a Caribbean cruise for only $38 a night. The only catch is it’s BYOB: Bring Your Own Boat.
In Argentina toy poodles are being sold that are actually ferrets on steroids.  Nice to see Lance Armstrong is keeping busy.
A man retrieved five $100 bills that his dog had swallowed and defecated out. Turns out the guy planned to use them to pay his income taxes.
Tonight is Wrestlemania 29.  Kim Jong-un reacts by threatening South Korea with a medium-range folding chair.
In Europe, IKEA pulled from its stores 17,000 portions of moose lasagna. The company was so embarrassed…it was supposed to be mouse lasagna.
Pres. Obama called Kamala Harris “the best-looking attorney general.” That night Michelle told him which sofa is “the best for sleeping.”
Recently North Korea moved a missile to its east coast.But don’t worry. Apparently they had to move it because people kept trying to eat it.
The disabled cruise ship Carnival Triumph broke loose from its dock. The reason? The mooring was made by the Carnival Chain Company.
Los Angeles has synchronized all of its traffic lights.  They did it so drivers being treated with medical marijuana can take naps.
Pizza Hut’s new pizza has a crust made of 16 pockets of cheese. It’s called “Crazy Cheesy Crust”, like what they’ll find in your arteries.
Tomorrow is April Fool’s Day.  The most popular pranks are expected to be kick-me signs, fake dog poo, and rubber nukes (North Korea only).
Widespread cheating was revealed in Atlanta public schools. As a result, the Real Housewives of Atlanta will have to repeat Season Three.
Now there’s a bacon-flavored condom. The makers say if you wear one you’ll never get a woman pregnant… because she’ll never want your genes.
A new study says adults text more than teens while driving. When asked to comment, Jon Hamm said, “At least I text without using my hands.”
Kim Kardashian said she’ll raise her children to “not see color.” But most experts say children should be raised to not see Kim Kardashian.
CNN reports controversy about bin Laden’s death. Secretive SEALs now say he was killed with a revolver, in the library, by a “Col. Mustard.”
Bill Gates will give $100,000 to whoever designs a better condom.  He got the idea right after seeing “Keeping Up with the Kardashians.”
Last night a large meteor lit up the sky over the East Coast.  It was so bright that for a second New Yorkers couldn’t see any cockroaches.
A French man was arrested on a US Airways plane for trespassing.The crew realized he was French when all the emergency oxygen masks dropped.
Congress is forcing the USPS to keep Saturday delivery. Apparently they can’t wait until Monday for their bribes,kickbacks, and pornography.
Today researchers recovered an Apollo rocket engine from the ocean floor. It was right next to an engine from a Carnival cruise ship.
A new N.Korean video shows an attack on Washington DC. But most North Koreans prefer to watch the video that shows them attacking a Big Mac.
“The Bible” producers deny Satan resembles Obama. No explanation for why the miniseries’ 7th Circle of Hell is a free,walk-in health clinic.
Just in time for St. Pat’s, bars in Washington DC have a Sequester Special: Drink until you can’t figure out how you’re going to pay for it.
On Monday Lindsay Lohan will appear in a courtroom, probably still driving the Porsche she was trying to park outside.
Today the Maryland legislature voted to end the death penalty. Instead, the very worst criminals will now be sentenced to life in Baltimore.
A Higgs boson was found by 6,000 physicists. The problem now is they’re all trying to book rooms for Nobel weekend at the Stockholm Ramada.
For violating people’s privacy Google was just fined $7 million. Google says it’ll direct deposit your share if you send it your bank PIN.
Judge blocks NYC Mayor Bloomberg’s ban on large, sugary drinks. Mayor’s next public health step: revoking the medical license of Dr. Pepper.
Sequester cuts are really affecting the military. Yesterday a drone flying to Pakistan asked directions from a seagull.
Daylight Saving Time started today, and even more political chaos.  Sequester cuts mean Washington DC only sprang ahead 53 minutes.
Starting today, no more public tours of the White House. Instead the administration is offering all-inclusive drone tours of Pakistan.
Reportedly the next “Star Wars” movie will feature 61-year-old Mark Hamill. He’ll play a new character: Luke Aluminumwalker.
Scientists are still having trouble identifying the Higgs boson.  Apparently it looks a lot like its twin – Mary-Kate Boson.
Scientists are very close to confirming the identity of a Higgs boson.  The final check:  Higgs shows up for a DNA test on “Maury.”
One of the top contenders to be Pope is Canadian.  We’ll know he was elected if that white smoke smells like bacon.
New study says Wal-Mart is the most popular place to fall in love. The same phenomenon explains the popularity of AMC’s “The Walking Dead.”
Officials say that spending cuts will mean more locked restrooms in national parks. So a bear won’t be the only one who sh*ts in the woods.
Sequester cuts affect screening at airport security checkpoints. All pat-downs will now be conducted by “the least creepy guy in line."
FAA investigating Harlem Shake on a plane. The last time they saw so many passengers twitching involved an overheated Boeing 787 battery.
The Tanning Mom is moving to London for a year to relax. Apparently she’s looking forward to frying fish and chips on her forehead.
A Chinese shipyard is building a copy of the Titanic. Chinese got hired because of all their experience making bootleg copies of the movie.
IKEA is pulling from stores its meatballs made of horsemeat. Instead it plans to resell 3,272 meatballs in an "assemble your own horse" kit.
Zero Dark Thirty is up for Best Picture. The producers seem confident. They just ordered a case of champagne to waterboard Kathryn Bigelow.
$100m suit says Lance Armstrong defrauded USPS by using drugs. Lance offers to settle suit by delivering 100m overnight letters personally.
Recent memo says #sequester could make National Park Service cut some big programs. For example, echoes in Grand Canyon wouldn’t come back.
A tipsheet found in Mali tells al-Qaida fighters how to hide from drones.  It could work. Tip #1: Wear a red-and-white-striped shirt & cap.
U.S. experts are very concerned about cyberattacks by the Chinese Army, warning if you get a fortune cookie from General Tso, don't open it.
U.S. authorities are investigating computer hacking by China.  They’ll know more this Sunday if the Best Actor Oscar goes to Kung Fu Panda.
Hong Kong Disneyland made a profit for the first time thanks to its new ride, The Haunted Mansion Made with Contaminated Chinese Drywall.
Scientists say the meteor blast over Chelyabinsk was so powerful that for a split second the name of the city was actually pronounceable.
Scientists say that Russian meteor broke so much glass & hurt so many people it was like a nightclub run-in between Drake & Chris Brown.
Meteor streaked in from outer space, blew up, and injured hundreds. Experts are concerned it could inspire a fifth “Transformers” movie.
It’s Valentine’s Day on the Carnival Triumph. Men are giving their ladies perfume from the gift shop to cover up the smell of raw sewage.
Carnival is giving each passenger on that crippled cruise ship five hundred dollars. Good timing. The ship just ran out of toilet paper.
So the Pope is stepping down.  I hear his caterer is planning a lavish retirement party: all-you-can-eat loaves and fishes.
Apparently North Korea's Kim Jong-un just conducted his first nuclear test.  He's glowing with pride.
Just got advance tickets for "Zero Dark Thirty."  The screening starts at Eleven Semi-Dark Fifteen.
